scenes.location: BUSH PLANE THE KILBUCK MOUNTAINS, ALASKA

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: On credit sequence...

dialogues.speaker: AN ARM
dialogues.text: stretched out.  Long, alabaster white.  Beautiful.  A WAS CLOTH enters frame.  Starts washing the arm with long, te strokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thick and auburn.  Being gently washed.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERNAILS
dialogues.text: being clipped with a shiny nail clipper.  Short.  Uniform Tidy.

dialogues.speaker: EYEBROWS
dialogues.text: brown with a touch of gold.  A BRUSH comes into view. Brushes against the eyebrow hair, then back again.  Again Then back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulled gingerly off a long leg.  Folded neatly.  The wash cloth begins between the toes.  Warm, soapy water.

dialogues.speaker: HAIR
dialogues.text: now dry.  The HAND appears with a comb.  Pulls down throu the thick tresses. It is only now that we see the hand is wearing a SURGICAL GLOVE. The gloved hand holds up the comb and pulls stray hairs f it.  Places them in a big, clear, plastic bag.  In the ba see the panty-hose, a folded flower dress, the nail clippings. Goes back to combing.  Comes across a knot and yanks the through.  The HEAD rolls over to us.  Her face is bruised her eyes blank.  She is lying on the floor. Dead. End of credit sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loud THRUM of a bush plane.  We CLOSE ON a small, clo window.  Through it we see an endless expanse of pine tre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  Just look at all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal HAP ECKHART and WILL DORMER sitting s by side.  Hap's at the window.  Greying moustache, a litt pudgy, wearing a brown suit.  Holding a folded over Seatt Times. HAP (cont'd) I thought we had a population problem. Everyone should just move up here. (taps window) Just look at it, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's eyes remain on the file on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Dormer.  Tall, handsome, expensively tailored suit. Snakeskin cowboy boots.  There's both a magnetism and a distance to him.  An intense mixture.  Hap glances at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing wrong with smelling the roses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks up.  We see the trace of a thick, ropy SCAR by Adam's apple.  There's tension between him and Hap, just below the surface.  He taps the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that to her, partner.

dialogues.speaker: THE FILE
dialogues.text: a stack of 8x10 PHOTOGRAPHS.  Of the dead girl.  Her eyes puffed up from bruises.  The whites bloody.  Contusions a her breasts and shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT's looking back at Will.  Wearing a leather red baron hat. PILOT (cont'd) Better check your belts.  We'll be landing in about fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will nods.  The plane lurches.  The file falls to the flo and the photographs scatter.  The pilot catches a glimpse them.  Looks at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small yellow plane veers left.  Clears a mountain top gives view to the spectacular Alaskan coastline.  The gre of the Bering sea, the blanket of pine trees, the jagged of the beaches.  Enormous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGN swinging in the wind: Nightmute, Alaska.  Halibut Fishing Capital of the World! PULL BACK to reveal it hanging from the eave of a small, corrugated building.  The "airport."  Nothing else for mi around. A mud-splattered Jeep Cherokee pulls up next to it.  Brak SCREECHING.  A YOUNG WOMAN hops out.  About 23.  Petite w short, brown hair. Peers up at the sky.  Brightens at the sight of the BUSH PLANE coming in for landing.  Smooths down her down vest. Making sure the GOLD SHIELD on her belt's visible.  Nervo Excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE BURR turns.  Shields her eyes from the sun.  An OLD hosing down the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Angstrom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie puffs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man screws up his face, confused.   MR. ANGSTROM (cont'd) Didn't you used to baby-sit for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't babysit any more, Mr. Angstrom. Just made detective three weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAT jumps down off the roof.  Angstrom sprays it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, Charlie must be short-handed down at the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, used to not being taken seriously.  Turns back to ROAR of the bush plane as it taxis down the strip.  Comin a stop.  She hurries over as the door swings open and... WILL DORMER steps down.  Slipping on his sunglasses. Scanning the nothingness around him.  Spots the swinging sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Halibut fishing capital of the world."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap, right behind him.  Rubs his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ought to be interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the engine) Detective Dormer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look down.  Ellie reaches up and takes Will's bag. his hand.  Shakes it vigorously. ELLIE (cont'd) It's a huge honor to meet you!  Ellie Burr.  I'm here to take you to the station!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will motions to Hap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My partner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Eckhart!  I know!  Welcome to Nightmute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads them away from the plane.  Takes Will's briefca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to say how incredible it is  to have you working with us, Detective Dormer.  I've followed all your cases. Theodore Dineli, Frank and Casey Prud'homme, the Port Angeles shootings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens the back of the Jeep.  Puts the bags inside. ELLIE (cont'd) ...And especially the Leland Street Murders.  That was my case study at the Academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot walks by.  Taps her on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your dad the game's gonna start late this week, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, Spence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at Will.  Can't help but focus in on his s Touches her own smooth neck.  In awe. ELLIE (cont'd) That's where Ronald Langley cut you in the basement of his father's house on 325 Leland, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will smiles, taken aback by this girl's exuberance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did your homework, Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a quick glance at Angstrom.  Out of ear-shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made detective three weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee parked next to a police car outside a plain, storey building.  The Nightmute Police Department.  A tot pole stands out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Dormer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightmute Police Chief CHARLES NYBACK gets up from behind desk with a big smile.  Ruddy, red hair sprinkled with gr Nyback wears a faded army sweater over his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limps from behind his desk and gives Will a shake and a s on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warmly) How you doing, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback shakes Hap's hand.  A reunion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ.  I haven't seen you boys since...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just after Leland Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years?  Where does it all go?  That was some amazing time, though, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks at Will.  Down at his boots. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) You haven't changed a bit, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.  Looks at Nyback's gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH.  Eyes twinkling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew that was coming.  I deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts back over to his desk.  Notices Ellie still standing by the door.  Points to Will. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Pay attention to this man, Ellie.  He'll teach you how to be a great cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie straightens.  Smiles.  Looks over at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all, for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, realises they want to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Right.  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backs out.  Quietly closing the door behind her.  Will unbuttons his jacket.  Takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits with a SIGH) Got a love affair with police work. Drives me crazy with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will surveys the fishing poles leaning against the gun ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping you busy up here, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap picks up a cheap trophy.  Reads the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "2nd prize Great Kodiak Salmon Catch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you seven years ago this was a  stepping stone to retirement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback nods to Hap's Seattle Times.  The headline:  "Deep Investigation into Special Branch"... CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Looks like it's a good time for you to get up here, too.  With all the bad business going on down at Special Branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Hap share a look.  No more joking.  Hap folds ov the paper. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Just five bad apples so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the D.A. got them on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four unwarranted shootings, witness intimidation, and cocaine theft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you?  How you faring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all over us, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all over everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.A.'s calling themselves the "Corruption Task Force."  Can you believe that? Trying to root out any mistakes or "oversights" any other Detectives may have made over the years.  They're turning it into a witch hunt.  Something on the news about it practically every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback pulls a stack of messages from his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a bunch of messages here from some guy named Warfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap tosses a glance over at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's I.A.'s pit bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wants me to keep him posted on all your movements up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback turns and ceremoniously drops the messages into th trash. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) I'm just glad Buck could spare you a couple of weeks.  Take you out of the frenzy.  I gotta tell you, though, I sure don't miss big city police work.  Not that I was ever a great detective.  But up here there's no Bureaucracy.  No Public Relations.  No blurred lines. Just good guys and bad guys.  Simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloud passes over his face. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Except for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holds up a file.  The name written on the lip:  KAY CONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback leads Will and Hap down a hallway.  Crooked plaque and black-and-white pictures line the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't get a thing from the body.  Not a trace.  Town's never dealt with anything like this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn a corner and stop at a door.  Will glances up: MOOSE ANTLERS hanging over it. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) I've briefed everybody about your coming. They know to follow your lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback opens the door onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the bullpen of Nightmute PD.  Wooden desks, a couple computers, a jumbled corkboard, an impressive gun cabinet RADIO's playing. Three MEN look over.  A young uniformed cop and two guys heavy facial hair, Timberland boots, and flannel shirts. of them's part Inuit.  Ellie sits in the back.  Reaches o to turn off the radio. Will and Hap stand in the doorway.  Sticking out like sor thumbs in their suits.  Nyback jerks his thumb towards th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Detective Dormer and his partner Detective Eckhart.  On loan from Buck Lundgard, Seattle Robbery and Homicide Special Branch.  They'll be helping with the Connell case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Inuit, FRED DUGGAR, snorts.  Takes his feet of the de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Anything they need to see, you show them; anywhere they want to go, you take them. (nods to Fred) This is Detective Fred Duggar.  He's been leading the investigation up to now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will puts out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred tugs at his dark handlebar moustache.  Stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you want to see the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred steps out of the station, pulls on a baseball cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can walk from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads off across the parking lot.  Will and Hap exchan glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that's what they call Alaskan hospitality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn.  Ellie's come up behind them.  Looks over at t hunched figure to Fred. ELLIE (cont'd) He's just mad 'cause you're taking over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred stops up ahead.  Sees her.  Annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie!  Go type something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a faucet.  A bead of water, quivering at the mou Falls with a BLIP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did a fundascopic examination and found papilledema and petechiae of the retina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal Will, Hap, and the COUNTY CORONER standing by a stainless steel table.  The naked body of K CONNELL is laid out before them.  Fred hangs back. The coroner tugs at her surgical gloves.  She's in her la seventies. CORONER (cont'd) Clear cause of death was herniation of the brain stem due to intracerebral hemorrhage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beaten to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beaten to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will points to the bruises on the body's shoulders and breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about these contusions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superficial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any signs of rape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coroner starts to cover the body with a sheet. CORONER (cont'd) She was a nice girl.  Played flute with my granddaughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stays her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the sheet back down.  Studying the body of Kay Connell.  Starts walking slowly around the table.  In his element.  The faucet drips.  Drips.  Drips. He bends down to smell her hair. WILL (cont'd) He washed her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a handful and lets it fall from his fingers. WILL (cont'd) Combed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continues around the table.  Picks up one of her hands. Examines her fingers, her nails. WILL (cont'd) Cleaned under her fingernails.  Clipped them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continues down around her feet.  Checks between her first second toes. WILL (cont'd) Toes, too. (to Fred) You found nothing on the body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fibers, skin flakes, hairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, no.  We know about those things up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands there.  Looking down at the body.  Slim.  You Beautiful.  Skin like marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew exactly what we'd be looking for. Made sure to cover up all his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the best make mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks up and locks eyes with his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Hap enter the lobby of the Pioneer Lodge.  Big s fireplace and heavy ceiling beams.  MOOSE ANTLERS mounted above reception.  They put their bags down by the desk. around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower forty-eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn.  RACHEL CLEMENT stands in a doorway behind the desk.  Dunking a teabag into a mug.  Long dark hair and intelligent eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower forty-eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not from here.  I can tell by your walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?  And how's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap smiles at her.  Will checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detectives Will Dormer and Hap Eckhart. There should be a reservation for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks at him.  Goes to a small file box on the des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hap) Your friend's all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances out the window.  It's as bright as day. WILL (cont'd) Is it really 9:30?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Alaskan summers.  Hope you're an easy sleeper.  It'll be like this all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands them two cards. RACHEL (cont'd) Sign here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's taken off his jacket and is unpacking.  The room i sparse and creaky.  Bed dips in the middle.  He hangs a jacket in the armoire then returns to his suitcase.  Pull out his SMITH AND WESSON 45. Lays it on the bedside table.  Takes out a shoulder holst A back holster.  A handful of shells.  Lays them on the  table.  Then a small SMITH AND WESSON 39/13 9MM.  Checks magazine. There's a KNOCK on the adjoining door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will SLAPS the magazine back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap opens the door.  A glimpse into his room: family PICT on his bedside table - a WOMAN and three teenage GIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you have the same decor as my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to the big window.  It overlooks the harbor Big, snow-capped mountains in the distance.  One lone TUG in the harbor towing a freighter. HAP (cont'd) Same view, too. (looks out) I've been watching that tugboat for the last half hour.  So small, pulling all that weight. (beat) We have to talk, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will reaches into his suitcase.  Pulls out a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will throws him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk when we get back to Seattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's that, a week?  Two weeks?... (heads over to him) We have to figure out a plan of action now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my plan of action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Will.  Warfield had me locked up in his office again for five hours yesterday.  Five hours.  Asking all kinds of questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's asking everybody questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's zeroing in on me.  On us. Everyone's talking about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just rattling your cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I gotta tell you.  With a wife, three kids, and a pension plan in the balance, it's rattling hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We say nothing.  It goes away.  Simple as that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will goes back to his suitcase.  Hap follows.  A thin fil sweat on his upper lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowers voice) Look.  We've tampered with evidence. We've pushed witnesses.  We've planted shit.  And they're sniffing around like dogs.  Especially on the Dobbs case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will flares up.  Struck a nerve.  Turns to his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weston Dobbs killed an eight year-old boy and left him hanging in the basement like a piece of meat.  You remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One word to I.A. and he walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not.  We could talk to Buck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut some kind of a deal.  I heard that's  what Flynn's doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Flynn's a dirty cop, Hap!  We are nothing like Mike Flynn.  We did what we needed to do to make sure that son-of- bitch Dobbs paid for what he did.  And every bastard like him.  We say one word about it and every case we ever brought in is going to blow wide open and they'll all walk.  Every last one.  And I am not going to let that happen.  No deals.  No compromises.  No discussions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a hanger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Will.  You grab on to something and you don't let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a handkerchief.  Wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if it's because you think it's the right thing to do or because your pride won't let you do anything else.  I can't tell any more. (steps back) But I can tell you one thing.  I'm getting too old for this cowboy cop stuff.  Breaking the rules.  Cleaning up messes.  We're a dying breed, Will. You're a dying breed.  I.A., the D.A., all those reporters - they don't care what you did at Leland Street seven years ago.  They don't care that you've made this your life.  They don't care about getting the bad guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns on his partner, eyes burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The partners, lock eyes.  Years of working together.  A thousand things unsaid.  Hap reaches for the door. HAP (cont'd) They're watching us, Will.  Like it or not.  They're watching us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's asleep.  Kay Connell's folder open on his chest. dark in his room, quiet.  Suddenly the shade on his windo quivers and SNAPS up, flooding the room with light. Will's eyes pop open.  He rolls over to look at the clock 3:15.  Squinting, he gets up and walks over to the window We can see the rest of his scar.  Runs down deep across h sternum. He yanks the shade back down.  It bucks, then settles. Satisfied, Will returns to bed.  Plumps the pillow, pulls blanket up around him.  Closes his eyes. The shade lurches halfway.  Then SNAPS back up.  Light po in.  Will's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will jogs along in a Sonics sweatshirt, a ring of sweat around his collar.  He looks out over the harbor.  Fishin boats coming in with their early morning haul.  More hali He checks his watch.  Slows to a walk.  Looks up and sees Ellie Burr standing on the front steps of the Pioneer Lod Smiles.  Holds up some car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred wants us to meet him at the Connell's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie driving.  A hula-girl, swinging from the rear-view mirror.  Will in the passenger seat.  Wearing a crisp sui Ellie hands him a take-out bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought you a bear claw.  Just in case you were hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes the bag.  Looks inside.  Yikes. ELLIE (cont'd) Local delicacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I'll pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the bag on the dash.  Looks out the window. Nightmute's main street.  A line of shops.  Undistinguish Town Hall.  Elementary school up on a hill.  Sign out fro Sign-ups for Midnight Little League! WILL (cont'd) What kind of calls you get around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  You know.  Small-time stuff. Nothing like what you must get.  Mostly drinking-related problems.  Domestic abuse.  Barroom fights.  Stuff like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shifts down.  Takes a steep turn. ELLIE (cont'd) In the summer months it's pretty quiet. That's when there's work out on the boats.  The rest of the year, though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a MAN walking along the road.  Gnarled walking stick.  Ellie calls out the window. ELLIE (cont'd) Hey, there, Joe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE waves.  They pass. ELLIE (cont'd) That's Joe Willy.  Took his family  hostage in November.  That was the most exciting thing that happened last year. I wasn't there, though. (grinds gear) Chief barely lets me handle anything above a misdemeanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks over at her.  Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give misdemeanors a bad rap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're so boring.  All small stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all about the small stuff.  Small lies.  Small mistakes.  Small oversights. People give themselves away in a traffic violation just as much as they do in a murder case.  It's human nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over.  Ellie's listening intently. WILL (cont'd) Aren't you going to write that down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, searching her pockets for something to write with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stops.  Looks over.  Realises Will's teasing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small ranch house.  Aluminum siding.  FLOWERS piled up the front door.  TEDDY BEARS.  RIBBONS.  Left by well-wis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't tidied up, since Fred told me not to touch anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. CONNELL, a big woman with a thick grey braid down he back, opens the door to her daughter's room.  Looks at Wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in keeping a child's room like a shrine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads into the room.  Hap follows.  A palpable uneasiness between them.  Fred and Ellie stand in the doorway.  Mrs. Connell turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small bedroom.  Pink shag carpeting and clouds painted the ceiling.  Pictures cut from magazines pasted on the walls.  A stack of tapes and a boom box in the corner. Will stands in the middle of the room.  Taking it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical seventeen year-old. (beat) She went to a party Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down at a local dive the kids like to hang out in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred throws Ellie a look.  "Kids?"  She's practically a k herself.  Will opens the top drawer of the bureau.  Roots beneath the panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No diary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On top of the bureau, a stack of photos.  A couple torn u Kay Connell and a GIRL with white-blonde hair.  Laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left the party early.  Friends said she had a fight with her boyfriend and stormed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around twelve-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap picks up a bear on Kay's bed.  A bell JINGLES when he shakes it.  Will crosses to a closet in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was the last one to see her alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy Stetz.  Her boyfriend.  We've questioned him, searched his place. Didn't find anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls a dress out of the closet.  Small, black, eleg The tag's been cut out.  He pulls out another, then anoth Feels the fabric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are designer.  Expensive. (looks up) Could Randy Stetz afford these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Ellie exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fixes boat engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks around.  Cheap wallpaper, torn window screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well her mother didn't buy them for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will reaches over to a heart-shaped box on the bedside ta Pulls out a pretty gold necklace.  Holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay Connell had an admirer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the dresses to Ellie.  Heads out of the room. WILL (cont'd) I want to talk to the boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a hand squeezing a shoulder.  Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem all that sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shoulder jerks away.  PULL BACK to reveal RANDY STETZ sitting at a wooden table in an interrogation room.  Long blond hair, wearing a Metallica t-shirt, trying like hell grow a moustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had a chance!  You fuckers been all over my back since Monday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a cigarette.  It's bent.  He lights it.  Hap sits opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know smoking stunts your growth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy throws him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, fat-ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles at Will) More Alaskan hospitality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will goes over to a coffee machine.  Pours a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you love her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay Connell.  Did you love her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy flicks his ash.  Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  She was nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns with his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She was nice."  Wow.  That makes me all soft inside.  Ever occur to you she didn't love you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me that time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She loved me.  She wanted to see me every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she was seeing someone else on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're fucking talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friday night, at the party - what'd you fight about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stuff.  I don't fucking remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that she left the party to go to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ran like hell to go to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, man! - I'm sick of all your fucking cop questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will suddenly hurls his coffee cup and grabs Randy up by collar.  Nose to nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you listen to me, you little shit. This fuck-the-world-Metallica-t-shirt  crap may work with your mamma, but it doesn't work with me.  You got mad at your girlfriend because she was seeing someone else.  You want to be the last person who saw her alive or are you going to tell me who that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's lip curls.  Red-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusted, Will shoves Randy back into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walking out of the interrogation room.  Ellie joins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a little surly, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will smooths back his hair.  Checks his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his pocket and pulls out the gold necklac from Kay's room.  Hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to check this out, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there wasn't any...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stops.  Ellie stops.  Will puts a hand on her should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small things - remember?  The second you're about to dismiss something - look at it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie smiles, teasing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to write that down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, has to smile.  She's quick.  Looks down the hall. bearded GUY on crutches.  Ellie follows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender at Darrow's.  He was there Friday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  He's up next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads over to him.  Ellie watches his neck.  Her han closing over the necklace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pioneer Lodge restaurant.  Small, dark wood, a RADIO playing something between Bluegrass and Folk.  Some rough looking GUYS at the bar.  Throwing looks over at... Will and Hap, sitting at a table.  Studying faded menus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) Halibut Calabrese.  Halibut Olympia. Halibut Cajun Style.  Halibut fish and chips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts down his menu.  Reaches for his drink. WILL (cont'd) Can't wait to see what's for dessert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least there's variety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will drains his drink.  Locks eyes with a big GUY over at bar.  Beer froth on his moustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the natives are restless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks back at his partner.  Hap's fidgeting with the of his tie. HAP (cont'd) I think, I think I'm gonna talk to Buck when we get back to Seattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold flash down Will's spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could stick it out like you.  I just, with Trish and the kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this, Hap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap avoids his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking I could get off with probation.  Keep half my pension.  That's all I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hisses) Goddammit, Hap.  Think about what you're doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be involved, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell Buck and I'm involved whether I like it or not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men look up, interrupted.  Rachel is standing by the table with a pad.  Hap tries to recover with a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - you do everything around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands abruptly.  Eyes on Hap.  Trying not to explod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just have another Scotch in my room. (turns to Rachel) If you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, his cell phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will bursts into the bullpen.  Hap behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, Fred, and a couple other GUYS huddled around a des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Hap head over to them.  One of the younger guys, FARRELL, intimidated by Will's presence.  Tucks his shirt into his dirty jeans. They part to reveal a BLUE KNAPSACK laying on the desk. spots all over it.  An embroidered daisy.  Will examines

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sure it's hers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has her books in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about prints?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie shakes her head, unfortunately not.  Will reaches i the bag.  Pulls out two text books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biology and Algebra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves the books towards one of the guys. WILL (cont'd) Find out who she studied with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues through the bag.  Pulls out a little plastic with "Hello Kittys" all over it.  Dumps out the contents. WILL (cont'd) Make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks up at Fred. WILL (cont'd) Find out where she bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred looks at him.  Not happy with make-up duty.  Will pu out a hair brush.  Hands it to Ellie. WILL (cont'd) Lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next, a couple worn paperbacks. WILL (cont'd) (reading titles) Otherwise Engaged, Murder at Sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at the group. WILL (cont'd) Who here reads this kind of crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell straightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read that kind of crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will tosses them to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read them.  Tell me anything that strikes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down to the bottom of the bag.  A Ziploc with a half-eate sandwich and an apple core.  Will hands them to Ellie. WILL (cont'd) Lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upends the knapsack.  Scraps, paper clips, gum wrappers. WILL (cont'd) That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred reaches for the knapsack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stick it in the evidence locker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes it, walks slowly over to the window.  Thinking Twists the knapsack in his hands and looks out at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOTEM POLE standing tall outside.  A black RAVEN alights top of it.  Pecks at the air.  Turns.  Seems to look righ Will. WILL (cont'd) We put it back where we found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns to them. WILL (cont'd) You said it was a fishing cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, right.  About two miles outside of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred tightens his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we taking it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will ignores the question.  Walks back towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This murder was in the papers, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  All over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call all of them from here to Anchorage. Tell them we now know that Kay Connell left the party with a dark blue knapsack, but we haven't recovered it yet. (checks watch) We can get it in by the morning editions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the bag to Farrell. WILL (cont'd) Fill this with random books.  Make it look heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls out a handkerchief.  Wipes the mud off his han Taking his time.  Finally turns to Fred. WILL (cont'd) It'll eat this guy alive if he thinks he overlooked a detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV through BINOCULARS A WOODEN CABIN comes into focus.  Right by the water.  Ha been used in years.  Weathered, slate roof.  Algae growin the sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.  Lighter than I remembered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL lowers his binoculars.  He's standing on the black r beach.  It's damp, slick, and cold.  A fog's rolling in. Hap and Farrell are sitting behind a cluster of rocks.  A couple paper bags and a megaphone.  They're comparing gun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glock 40.  All plastic save the barrel and firing pin.  Never rusts.  What do you carry down in Seattle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap reaches into his holster.  Pulls out a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith and Wesson 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Duggar's standing on the other side of them.  He's g pair of binoculars, too.  They're staking out the cabin. Been there a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought some coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie appears with a thermos.  Crouching down.  Fred turn annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering for her) I told her to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred shoots Will a look.  Down at his cowboy boots.  Will gives him a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.                Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred goes back to scanning, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this guy doesn't read the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or goes straight to the Sports Section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap and Farrell chuckle.  Hap unscrews the thermos.  A cl of steam. HAP (cont'd) Who gets first dibs? (looks up at Will) Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks down at his partner.  Holding out the thermos a weird kind of truce.  Will turns away, rejecting it.  A swath of thick fog unfolds over the black rocks as... Fred tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking through binoculars) I see someone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap and Farrell scramble to their feet.  Will whips up hi binoculars. POV THROUGH WILL'S BINOCULARS - a FIGURE making its way t the cabin.  Furtive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will lowers the binoculars.  Snaps his fingers at the men

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL (cont'd) Fan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, Farrell and Hap.  Start spreading out.  Ellie steps up.  Will looks back at her.  Too dangerous. WILL (cont'd) Stay here, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will puts up his hand.  She stops short.  He plunges ahea Hap.  Will.  Farrell.  Fred.  Fanning out.  Silent.  Keep eye-contact.  Will points to Farrell.  Wants the megaphon Farrell, balancing on a rock, holds it out.  Accidentally keys it.  The feedback SQUAWKS.  Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's bolting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV THROUGH WILL'S BINOCULARS - the FIGURE, looking aroun running towards the cabin.  Leaping from rock to rock. WILL reaches for his Smith and Wesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!  Go!  Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men jump into action.  Race down towards the cabin. Fred and Farrell, nimble over the wet rocks.  Will and Ha harder going.  Grab onto jagged edges, slip down small crevices.  Rocks sticking out every which way.  The fog, thick and white... THE FIGURE disappears into the cabin. FRED AND FARRELL leap up onto a tall boulder and jump dow Run over to the door of the cabin, guns at the ready... WILL rounds the boulder, Hap panting behind him.  Joins F and Farrell at the door. Will levels his Smith and Wesson at the door, and with a to Fred as he KICKS it in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the door CRACKS and swings in.  The men rush inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look around:  Nothing.  A few old nets, a wooden tab rotted through.  No knapsack. In the corner, a TRAP DOOR, left open.  Will races over. Looks down into the darkness. WILL (cont'd) Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns and points to Farrell. WILL (cont'd) You!  Head back up to base... (to Fred) You!  Go right and follow along the water... (to Hap) Hap!  You go left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men nod. WILL (cont'd) Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush out the door and split directions.  Will crouch down by the trap door and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...drops down into a dark, dank TUNNEL.  Water dripping. FOOTFALLS echoing.  Will cocks his head.  Left or right? Starts sprinting down towards the lighter end of the tunn his own footsteps bouncing against the tunnel walls.  He rounds a curve.  Sound recedes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He exits the tunnel onto the rocky beach.  Stops short

dialogues.speaker: FOG
dialogues.text: has enveloped everything - obscuring all vision, dulling sound.  Like a strange dream.  Eerie. Will blinks against the thick whiteness.  Strains to hear sound, anything.  There's only the distant LAPPING of the water. He tightens his grip on his gun and plunges into the fog. Quick, careful steps.  Stumbles over a rock.  Waves his g in defense.  Eyes wide open like a blind man...

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: a GUNSHOT.  Off to the right.  Will whips his head around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, alone, jumps at the sound.  Reaches for her weapon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads towards the sound.  Reaching out for approachi rocks.  Scrambles over a small bank and finds... FARRELL rolled up into a fetal position on the ground.  Clutching his thigh.  Blood seeping through his fingers. looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell can't answer that. WILL (cont'd) (impatient) Where'd the shot come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell lifts his bloody hand.  Points off towards the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will disappears back into the fog, leaving Farrell behind Clambers back down towards the water, pausing every few  seconds to listen, to adjust.  Heart POUNDING.  Blood  pumping.  Like an animal tracking its prey.  Leaps up ont plateau of rocks when...

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: a DARK FIGURE flashes past him.  The killer!  Inches away.  Will wheels around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK!  Squeezes off a shot.  Misses!  Can't believe it. Goes for another... Nothing!  Jammed!  The figure, disappearing.  Will tosses his Smith and Wesson, reaches behind his back and whips out his SMITH 39/13...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, weapon drawn, making her way down the rocks.  A HA suddenly grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Ellie!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred emerges from the fog. FRED (cont'd) Put that thing away!  Farrell's down!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! as another shot rips through the air.  Fred and El freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Ellie, skittering down the rocks.  Getting close the water.  Hear a voice ring out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fog starts to dissipate.  They reach the water to see

dialogues.speaker: WILL DORMER
dialogues.text: kneeling beside the body of his partner.  Lying in the wa Shot in the stomach.  Blood dribbling from his mouth.  Wi grabs him up by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starts shaking the limp body.  Teeth clenched. WILL (cont'd) Hap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap's head, rolls back.  Mouth agape.  Face white... Will, rips off his tie.  Presses it to the gaping wound.. trying to stop the bleeding...warm blood, pumping into th water... Ellie watches.  Horrified.  Fred races over to the body. Feels for Hap's pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dormer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, shaking Hap again.  Jaw set.  Eyes intense.  Veins popping up along his temples.  Fred catches his shoulder. FRED (cont'd) Dormer!  He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks up at Fred.  His face contorts. Suddenly leaps to his feet.  Grabs a rock and hurls it savagely into the thick fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Nyback sits in his chair.  Fingers interlaced.  A  somber expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you lost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits opposite him.  Wet, dishevelled, dirty.  Hap's blood smeared all over his shirt.  Staring off into space

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I lost him.  In the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About how long 'til you heard the suspect's second shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty, thirty seconds.  I followed the sound down to the water.  That's where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blinks.  Looks down.  Swallows. WILL (cont'd) That's where I found Hap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback sighs, shakes his head.  Reaches down to his botto drawer and pulls out a bottle of bourbon and a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you need a glass of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to unscrew the bottle, but Will shakes his head. Stands.  Paces.  Rakes his hand through his hair. Turns suddenly and swipes his arm across Nyback's desk. Everything CRASHES to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells) Why didn't I know about that goddamn tunnel, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback looks up at him.  Calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bunch of those tunnels out there, Will.  From bunkers over sixty years old.  I don't even know half of them myself, and I grew up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will clenches his fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had him, Charlie.  Right in front of me.  Not two feet.  I could smell the son- of-a-bitch.  Playing with me.  And I missed the shot.  He was right there and I missed the shot!  Then my goddamned gun jammed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback gets up.  Limps over to his old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, you can't blame yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only gonna make you crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then there's a soft KNOCK on the door.  The men look over.  Ellie sticks her head in.  Speaks in a tone that belies that a man has recently died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns his back to her.  Nyback heads over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie flicks a look at the pile on the floor.  At Will's back. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) I want you to take care of the investigation into Detective Eckhart's shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie looks at him.  Confused.  Lowers her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the Connell case?  I'm on the Connell case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback puts a hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need paperwork, Ellie.  You know that. Just write up a quick report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie's shoulders droop.  Thought she was playing with th big boys.  Just then Will turns abruptly and grabs his co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to check on the roadblocks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback catches his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're no good right now, Will.  Go back to the Lodge.  Try to get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks at him.  Know's he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a SQUEALING tire, ripping around a curve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will driving.  Speeding.  Scenery whipping past the windo His hands, tight around the steering wheel.  The hula-gir dancing beneath the rear view mirror, a smile plastered t her face. He grows suddenly pale.  Pulls the Cherokee off to the si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will jumps out of the Cherokee, leaving the door open.  R down an ALLEY behind a row of shops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple industrial trash bins.  Will leans his hand agai the wall and vomits.  Hovers for a moment, saliva drippin from his mouth.  Braces himself.  Heaves again.  Hears a  BUZZING behind him.  Turns. A DEAD DOG lying next to a dumpster.  FLIES buzzing aroun its head.  Teeth bared.  Eyes wide open. Like it's watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks up to reception.  No one there.  Just wants hi key.  Rings the bell.  In the back room, he hears a RADIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...earlier this evening after an aborted attempt to apprehend a suspect.  He was forty-five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It clicks off abruptly.  Rachel appears in the doorway. Takes in the blood on Will's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks at her.  She walks over to the desk. RACHEL (cont'd) It's been on the radio for the last two hours.  Nothing but that.  Like when they found Kay Connell's body. (sympathetic smile) We're not used to this sort of thing up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for his key. RACHEL (cont'd) He was standing right there just a couple of days ago.  Your partner.  Exactly where you are now. (beat) I hope I was nice to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes his key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were nice to him.  He liked you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles faintly, turns to go.  Just then the phone RING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering) Pioneer Lodge?... (listens) Hold on a second.  He's right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stops.  Turns.  Rachel holds up the phone.  Covering mouthpiece. RACHEL (cont'd) John Warfield.  He's called a couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's stomach drops.  That's the last phone call in the  world he wants to take.  Rachel reads his face. RACHEL (cont'd) Want me to lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shakes his head.  Steps back and takes the phone. Clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Dormer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUSE.  A bemused VOICE on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer.  I've been trying to reach you.  I was very sorry to hear about your partner, Detective Eckhart. It must have been a terrible shock, what happened this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.  Not giving this asshole an inch.  Rachel, trying n to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) That's not exactly how I'd put it. WARFIELD'S VOICE (cont'd) No, no.  I suppose not.  But I look forward to reading the report.  Very sad.  Very sad.  Funny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What do you mean, "Funny?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing.  Just that I felt Detective Eckhart and I, Hap and I, were starting to make a real connection before you left.  I sensed that he was ready to get some things off his chest.  Did you sense anything like that, Detective?  I mean, as his partner?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, squeezing the phone cord with his bloody fist. WARFIELD'S VOICE (cont'd) ...You were his partner for, what, about ten years?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns from Rachel.  Eyes burning.  Voice steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) You know why everyone hates you, Warfield?  It's not your questions, it's not your press conferences, it's not even your cheap suits; everyone hates you 'cause day after day you suck the marrow out of real cops when you never had the balls to become one yourself.  Well I got to tell you, it's a shame you're not up here with me because I'd love to show you right now just what a real cop is capable of.  You just remember that when you're sitting at your bullshit desk reading your bullshit report on my dead partner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM!  He hangs up the phone.  Runs his hand through his hair.  Turns back to Rachel. WILL (cont'd) Next time.  Go ahead and lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fog everywhere.  Dense.  White.  Suffocating. We're running through it.  Clambering over rocks.  Hearin the sound of our own BREATHING.  Our own HEARTBEAT. Adrenaline pumping.  An animal tracking its prey... SUDDENLY a DARK FIGURE flashes past.  Just inches away.  Playing with us.  Taunt us.  We whip round with our weapon and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!  Will bolts upright in bed.  A film of sweat over h body.  Breathing hard.  The sound that woke him: the wind shade FLAPPING open.  LIGHT floods the room. Will gets up.  Goes over to the shade and pulls it down. lurches up halfway.  He tugs it down again.  It slaps all way open.  Will yanks it down so hard it rips off the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets tangled in it. WILL (cont'd) Goddamned...thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls it off and flings it in the corner. INT. WILL'S ROOM - 4:22 A.M. The digital clock flips to a new minute:  4:23.  Will, pacing.  Scratching at his stubble.  Unable to sleep.  Ke stepping on a SQUEAKY floorboard. Slows near the ADJOINING DOOR that leads into Hap's room. Hovers.  Lightly pushes the door open.  Sees... THE PICTURES on the bedside table.  A WOMAN and three tee GIRLS.  Hap's family. INT. BATHROOM - 5:18 A.M. Water gushing out of the faucet.  Will's WATCH sitting on sink's edge.  5:18. Will reaches up into the open medicine cabinet for a bott of aspirin.  Shakes out a couple.  Cups his hand under th water and knocks the pills back. Closes the medicine cabinet and CRIES out...

dialogues.speaker: HAP'S REFLECTION
dialogues.text: looming behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're watching us, Will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will whirls around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nothing.  No one's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON running shoes, POUNDING the tarmac.  PULL BACK t reveal Will running down Nightmute's main street.  Eyes bloodshot. A COUPLE NATIVE ALASKANS walking into a hardware store. talking and glance over at him. A YOUNG MOTHER in her husband's work shirt.  Lifts her sm KIDS into the cab of a 4x4.  Watches him pass. AN OLDER MAN fixing the broken "E" on his store front.  T at the sound of Will's footfall. Everyone edgy.  Cautious.  A murderer amongst them. Will continues on.  Looking straight ahead.  Wipes the sw from his neck.  Slows to a stop just outside the...

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL CONVENIENCE STORE
dialogues.text: A blown-up picture of KAY CONNELL in the window.  Below, painted sign:  We miss you, Kay. A stack of newspapers by the front door.  The "Nightmute Ledger."  The headline:  Seattle Cop Killed by Suspect. Will picks one up.  Stares down at it.  Rain starts to do the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We're going to bring down a couple of guys from Ridgemount, but I want us to step up the investigation here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain hammering against the windows.  Chief Nyback address the bullpen.  Everyone's there except Farrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nightmute hasn't lost an officer in thirty-seven years, and even though Detective Eckhart wasn't from here, he was as good as one of us on this case.  I had the honor of working with him down in Seattle for a number of years.  He was a fine detective and an even better man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands nearby, watching the rain hit the windows.  H suit pants are slightly wrinkled.  Nyback nods towards Fr CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Fred, you'll be working with Detective Dormer directly from now on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, stroking his moustache, nods.  Nyback turns to Will CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Will?  Anything you'd like to add?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks up.  Everyone's eyes turn to him.  He shakes h head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Then let's get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feet shuffling.  Chairs scraping the floor as people get A sense of determination in the air.  Will grabs his coat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns.  Ellie is beside him, holding a map. ELLIE (cont'd) I'm sorry to bother you, but I was asked to write the report on... (lowers eyes) ...you know what I was asked to write the report on... (looks back up) ...Could you, just to be accurate, for the report, could you just point out where you were when you saw Detective Eckhart yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out the map.  It's of the small stretch of coastline.  Red circles marking various points. Will looks down at her.  Takes the map.  Turns it around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to be accurate, Ellie.  You're doing your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the map.  Ellie watching his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry about what happened.  I know you did everything you could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will points to a spot.  Cutting her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands her back the map.  Smiles.  Just then Fred walks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dormer.  Still no sign of the bullet that went through Farrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the hospital to talk to him now. (looks at his watch) You get the search party together.  No fewer than thirty people.  I'll meet you in exactly twenty-five minutes.  Don't waste any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls on his coat and heads for the door.  Fred watche him leave.  Sticks a toothpick in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partner or no partner.  That guy's a prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to be a prick, Fred.  He's a great detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the cover of one of the paperbacks, Otherwise Engaged by Walter Byrd. PULL BACK to reveal Farrell lying in a hospital bed in striped pajamas, reading it.  A tear runs down his cheek he turns the page. A SNICKERS BAR is tossed onto his lap.  He looks up.  Fac brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands by his bed.  Farrell puts down the book.  Pic up the Snickers. FARRELL (cont'd) You don't seem like the bring-an- underling-who's-in-the-hospital-a- Snickers-bar kind of guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up a chair.  Nods to the paperback. WILL (cont'd) How's the book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell bites into the candy bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a real tear-jerker.  Brody, the good guy, just got shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops chewing.  Realises the association.  Swallows uncomfortably. FARRELL (cont'd) Oh.  I'm sorry.  About Hap.  Detective Eckhart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I'd had the chance to get to know him better.  Take him fishing or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would have liked that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just gotta catch the bastard, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here.  I need to know exactly what you saw yesterday, Farrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I saw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.  It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell takes another bite of the Snickers.  Like a littl boy.  Furrows his brow, trying to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much nothing.  That fog was so thick.  The bullet seemed to come out of nowhere.  I don't even remember seeing  any shapes.  Then I saw you.  But only when you came up close.  Then you disappeared again. (shrugs) I guess I heard more than I saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sighs, rubs his eyes. FARRELL (cont'd) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.  Don't be sorry.  It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a NURSE comes in with a Dixie cup.  Pretty, freckled face.  Not much older than Kay Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for your meds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell smiles at her, winks at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lonnie and I went to high school together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lonnie gives him the cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take the pills, Farrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the leg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know.  Don't feel that much. Bullet went right through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Got lost in the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get the other one, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks up.  Farrell pops the rest of the Snickers in mouth. FARRELL (cont'd) After the autopsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks down the hallway.  Light pouring in from a set high windows.  He looks tired.  Set-upon. POV of SOMEONE WATCHING HIM.  From a doorway.  Not close, not far.  A HA comes into view.  Small.  Bruised knuckles.  Holds on to door jamb.  Watches as... Will suddenly stops.  Skin prickling at the back of his n Turns and looks around. A MAN in a wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE GIRL tugging at her hospital gown. A couple of NURSES laughing at check-in. An empty doorway. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the beach.  We see nothing but fog.  A VOICE come through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and it was at this point that Detective Dormer headed towards the noise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie emerges from the fog.  Carrying the map and talking into a small tape recorder.  She's climbing over the rock wearing a windbreaker a couple sizes too big. A UNIFORMED OFFICER follows, carrying a camera.  She turn him. ELLIE (cont'd) Remember, Kepp, shoot everything... (back to the tape recorder) ...wherein he discovered the wounded Detective Farrell Brooks, having been shot in the vastus externus of the upper left thigh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs over the same bank Will Dormer climbed two evenings before.  Finds... ANOTHER UNIFORMED OFFICER, hanging out and smoking. ELLIE (cont'd) Francis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up.  Pimples on his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be Farrell.  Shot in the thigh and writhing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Ellie.  What's it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accuracy.  That's what. (points to the ground) Now get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis looks up at her.  Flicks his cigarette away and g down amongst the rocks.  Holds his thigh like he was shot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK!  Kepp takes the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie sloshes through the water.  Ankles getting cold. Cheeks pink.  But it doesn't matter.  She's investigating

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into tape recorder) ...shortly after hearing the second shot, Detective Dormer continued through the water until he spotted the body, lying approximately fifteen feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.  Looks at the map.  At the spot Will pointed o Looks back up.  Fog.  Clicks off the recorder.  Calls out ELLIE (cont'd) You there, Rich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE calls back.  Someone pretending to be Hap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  And I'm freezing my nads off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie furrows her brow.  Just then... FRANCIS appears.  Slips on a rock but catches his fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie!  Think I found something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a row of FEET.  Mostly boots.  Some more beat-up than others.  Inching forward along a road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anything catches your eye, you put it in a bag.  Anything looks strange, you put it in a bag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal a long line of PEOPLE stretched out across the road about a mile up the beach.  Some old, som young.  Linking arms and moving forward.  Looking down. SEARCH PARTY. Will, walking up and down behind the line.  Talking throu megaphone. WILL (cont'd) ...Anything he may have dropped, moved, kicked, or stepped on, you put in a bag. Cigarette butts, gum wrappers, paper clips, coins, buttons - nine times out of ten a suspect leaves something behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns.  A couple burly GUYS with some BLOODHOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will points over to the woods on the other side of the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woods.  One group heading south, the other heading north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nods to Fred who's standing nearby.  He hands the guys tw radios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure they're set to channel 6...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then two young OFFICERS pull up in a squad car.  You and apple-cheeked.  The first one holding a piece of pape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did the interviews with all the nearby houses like you asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Here's a list of who we talked to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands the list to Will.  He glances it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Go back and set up some follow- ups for this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officers nod, put the car in reverse.  Fred saunters over.  Nods towards the searchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think they should start further back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to have exited here.  Over those boulders.  I saw him move, he's nimble. Would have taken the hardest way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred shrugs, skeptical.  Just then, his cell phone BLEATS He reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duggar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks back at the search team.  Slow.  Meticulous. FRED (cont'd) (into phone) Where was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local WOMAN.  At the end of the line.  Glances over her shoulder.  Looks at Will.  Smiles.  You'll help us catch FRED (cont'd) (into phone) Okay.  (slaps phone closed) That was Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns back to him. FRED (cont'd) They found Farrell's bullet.  Says it looks like a 357.  After the autopsy Rich can drive 'em both to the lab in Anchorage.  Have a murder weapon by morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred crosses his arms.  Sarcastic. FRED (cont'd) That is, if it's alright with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder RUMBLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel winding an old grandfather clock with a key.  Look about a hundred years old. Will enters the lobby.  Soaked through.  Carrying an arml of wet files.  Rachel turns, sees him.  Reaches over to a umbrella stand.  Hands him an umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  It's on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes it.  Preoccupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts up the stairs.  Notices Rachel straining to ret the key to the top of the clock.  Backtracks to help her. She gets it without his help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. (smiles) Don't know why I bother.  It's been broken for two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Habit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks at him.  Can't figure this guy out.  Remembe something. RACHEL (cont'd) Oh.  A man came by to see you earlier. Said he was your new partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TINGLE skips down Will's spine.  He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Duggar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He didn't say what his name was. Only that you were expecting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not expecting anyone.
