dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what he thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel thinks for a second.  Leaning against the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short.  Dark hair.  Not that memorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will nods, rubs his forehead.  Suddenly has a pounding headache.  Turns for the stairs.  Hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to borrow something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a nail.  One THWACK of a hammer and it bites int the wall.  PULL BACK to reveal Will nailing the corner of blanket to one side of the window.  An ad hoc curtain. He finishes that side.  Starts to stretch the blanket acr the window.  Hesitates.  Looks outside.  To the left.  To right.  To see if anybody's out there.  If anybody's watching.  Sees instead... A LONE TUGBOAT chugging across the harbor.  Pulling a hug freighter.  Will squeezes his eyes shut.  Opens them agai Pulls the blanket fully across the window. INT. WILL'S ROOM - 1:05 A.M. The FILES spread across the floor.  Their edges buckled f the rain.  Dozens of pictures of Kay Connell.  School records.  Private letters.  Health files.  Coroner's repo Will.  Pacing.  Back and forth.  Thinking.  Over that sam SQUEAKY floorboard.  The clock reads: 1:05. INT. WILL'S ROOM - 2:20 A.M. Will lying in bed.  On top of the blanket.  Wide awake. Staring at the ADJOINING DOOR.  Into Hap's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, in a sweatshirt and coat, heads down the front step the Pioneer Lodge.  Jams his hands in his pockets.  The w of an insomniac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walking down main street.  In the middle of the road The dead of night.  No cars.  The sky a blinding white. Hears some rowdy NOISE coming from a corner bar, beer lig flickering.  A WOMAN rides by on a bicycle.  Birds SINGIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not day.  Not night.  Stuck somewhere in between.  Like a dream. Turns down a side street.  Passing more stores.  Guns and Ammo.  Patty's Hair and Nails.  General Store.  Comes upo

dialogues.speaker: THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: where he vomited the day before.  Stops.  Sees the DEAD D still down at the end.  Half obscured by the dumpster. Will wavers, pale.  Suddenly... A HOMELESS MAN emerges from the shadows.  Big.  Wild-eyed Awakened from his sleep.  Will, quickly backtracks to the sidewalk.  Spooked. JUST THEN the CRACK! of bat hitting ball.  He turns.  In distance.  Nightmute Elementary School.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Little League game in full swing.  The uniforms, a litt faded.  The diamond, a little unkempt.  A smattering of SPECTATORS.  Mostly dads with six-packs. Will wanders over to the fence.  Spots Ellie sitting alon the bottom bleacher.

dialogues.speaker: SOMEONE
dialogues.text: WATCHING HIM.  From afar.  The SOUNDS of the game, delaye few seconds.  Watches as Will crosses to the bleachers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sits down next to Ellie.  She turns, surprised. ELLIE (cont'd) Detective Dormer!  What are you doing here? (looks at watch) It's two-thirty in the morning. Shouldn't you be asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will glances out at the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could say the same thing about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  We always have play-offs in the middle of the night.  It's the best time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's playing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Puffins and the Hawks.  We're in extra innings.  The Hawks have a really good line-up this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sips on a take-out coke.  Looks back at the game.  A plump, redheaded GIRL comes up to bat.  Blows a bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks over just in time to see the girl swing and mi by a mile.  Ellie cups her hands around her mouth. ELLIE (cont'd) (calling out) That's okay, Lib! (to Will) Usually she's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She your only sibling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Twelve years younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Libby takes another swing.  Connects with the ball.  Drop the bat and runs to first.  Ellie gives a sharp WHISTLE. ELLIE (cont'd) What about you?  You have any siblings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (rubs his eyes) Well.  I had a brother.  He died when I was eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, sits up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I shouldn't have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  Happened a long time ago.  He was killed in a fire.  In New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must have been awful for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will leans back.  Stretching his legs.  Remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  (slight smile) I remember I was more embarrassed that he had died.  Embarrassed that it made me different.  So I didn't tell the other kids at school what had happened.  They'd ask  me where he was, where he'd gone.  And I'd make up stories.  He was visiting an aunt up north, he'd broken his leg, he was in a  Swiss boarding school.  Stuff like that. (shakes his head) Nice kid, huh?  Just kept making up more and more lies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he stops talking.  Slowly sits up.  Sensing  something.  Ellie, noticing the shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The row of DADS behind them.  Jump up and start CHEERING.

dialogues.speaker: THE PERSON
dialogues.text: WATCHING WILL.  Sees him sit up.  Look around.  That same prickle at the back of his neck.  A KID slides home just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Will stands.  Trying to shake the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to the Lodge, Ellie. Still need to go through some of Kay Connell's school records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go, scanning the area.  Ellie calls after him ELLIE (cont'd) Try to get some sleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nightmute morgue.  Next morning.  A SQUAD CAR pulls u Francis gets out, whistling.  Starts for the morgue's entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will in the Cherokee.  Dark circles under his eyes.  Suit jacket wrinkled.  Pulls in next to Francis' squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out window) Officer!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pick it up.  You head back to the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walking down a hallway.  Fluorescent lights. Cinderblock walls.  On his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duggar - I'm at the coroner's now.  I'll be back in about twenty minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stops at an open doorway in time to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CORONER pull a sheet over the cold, blue body of Hap Eckhart. Will's heart lurches.  He grabs on to the door jamb.  Was ready for that.  The coroner looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective.  Thought you were sending one of your lackeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will clears his throat.  Closes his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was better if I came.  Under the circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coroner nods.  Goes to wash her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's different when you know them, isn't it? (nods to clipboard) Just sign over there and she's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrugs off her lab coat.  She's wearing a blue dress.  Lo like a piano teacher.  Heads into an adjoining office. Will.  Alone.  Steps into the room.  The smell of formaldehyde.  Bloody instruments on a stainless steel tr Walks towards the clipboard, eyes flicking over to the sh under the sheet when... SUDDENLY Hap's HAND drops down.  Thick fingers.  Wedding band. Will jumps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your partner didn't suffer much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coroner re-emerges from the office with a manila envelope.  Hap Eckhart written on it in black pen. CORONER (cont'd) Maybe for a minute or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will rubs his face.  Tries to focus on the clipboard.  Th coroner holds out the envelope.  Smiles. CORONER (cont'd) Just enough time to reflect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the envelope.  The coroner peers up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking a little green, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Duggar, dialing the phone at his cluttered desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the other bullets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up.  Will standing before him, holding the manil envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a key slipping into a padlock.  Opens with a CLI PULL BACK to reveal Fred and Will in a small storage room Standing in front of an army-green LOCKER.  The evidence locker.  Room's stuffed with old files and boxes.  MOOSE ANTLERS hanging over a small window.  Will glances up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with all the moose antlers around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred throws a look over his shoulder.  Opens the locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of moose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE LOCKER - another manila envelope.  The name on this one: Farrell Brooks. Fred reaches back for the other envelope.  Will, hesitant give it to him.  Feeling the bump of the bullet in the bo corner.  Hands it over.  Wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's Rich coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred slides it in beside Farrell's.  Closes the locker do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I need a copy of the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred turns, a twinkle in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't Seattle, Detective.  We don't have copies. (holds up key) This is the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks at him.  At the key.  Plucks it from his hand. Just then Nyback's SECRETARY appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer?  Telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secretary hands Will the phone.  Pulls something from under the desk.  A beat-up BOX.  Will's name on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This came for you earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will glances at it.  Takes the phone.  Rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Dormer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Someone's there but they're not saying anything Will, too tired for this shit... WILL (cont'd) Goddammit, Warfield, if you're gonna check up on me every...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...the VOICE.  A MAN's voice.  Not John Warfield's. This voice is medium-ranged.  Higher.  Nose sounds stuffe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you haven't been getting much sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will straightens.  Something weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little TITTER on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lower-48s.  You think the white nights are kind of neat.  Then you can't sleep for days.  I've seen it happen about a million times.  But you can't sleep for a different reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAUSE.  Will loosens his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I said, who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice.  Dropping to a WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw what really happened, Will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, furrows his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you kill your partner.  With your back-up weapon.  Out there on the beach. I saw you shoot him dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Dormer's face. As all the blood drains from it. As all SOUND fades around him. As his heart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: begins to POUND against his chest. He falters, reaching out for the desk.  To steady himself As if the floor's just dropped out beneath him.  Eyes, darting around the bullpen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, into phone) Now you listen to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  I won't tell anyone.  Oh, and I saw you take my gun.  My uncle's old 357.  I dropped it in the rocks. But you can go ahead and keep that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIEF NYBACK, exits his office.  Looks at Will and smiles MAN'S VOICE (cont'd) ...I mean... (beat) ...Now that we're partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.  The line goes dead. Will, throat constricted.  Listening to the DIAL TONE. Smiles back at Nyback.  Turns.  Slowly hangs up the phone White as a sheet.  Trying to act normal.  Trying to act c SOUND returning to the bullpen, like nothing's different. Looks over at

dialogues.speaker: THE BOX
dialogues.text: sitting on the edge of the secretary's desk.  He reaches it.  Carefully, rips the packing tape.  Bends back a flap Inside, some dark blue material.  An embroidered daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay Connell's knapsack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, heading for the Cherokee.  Clutching the box.  Face pale, pace quick.  Everything's different now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes.  Now is not the time.  Reaches the Cherokee.  Yanks open the driver's side door.  Ellie catc up with him.  Out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you're in a hurry.  I just wanted to ask you about these pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, holds up some PHOTOGRAPHS.  They're of the BE The ones Kepp took.  Almost all fog. ELLIE (cont'd) I know they're not great quality, but this is where you said you were when you first saw Detective Eckhart, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.  Barely glancing at them.  Tosses the box into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets in and closes the door.  Puts his hand over the box. Ellie comes up to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But here's the thing.  I retraced your exact steps according to your statement. You couldn't have seen Detective Eckhart from there.  I mean, not in that fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then change it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much closer would you say you were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five feet?  Seven feet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, about to seriously lose his shit.  Looks at Ellie. Eyes dark, distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Ellie.  I don't have time for this shit.  Five feet, seven feet, twenty feet.  Put down whatever you want in your report, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the ignition.  Pulls out with a SQUEAL.  Ellie steps back, watching him drive away.  More curious than stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee.  Parked off-road.  A remote spot by the wat The driver's side door, left open.  The PING-PING-PING of interior BELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Dormer, walking along a breakfront.  Aimless.  One f in front of the other.  Staring out at nothing.  The endl sea.  Waves CRASHING.  Wind HOWLING.  Seagulls SCREECHING Everything.  Closing in on him... He stumbles over a rock.  Grabs his head in his hands. Stunned.  Guilty.  Ashamed.  Fucked. He saw it.  He saw it! A WAVE, explodes nearby.  Drenching him in sea spray. Will turns, raking his hand across his face.  Blinking. stinging.  Trying to focus.  Trying to think this through Hears a dog BARKING in the distance. Shakes his head.  Looks at his watch. Got to deal with the problem at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, bursts into his room at the Lodge.  The shoulders o his coat still wet with sea spray.  Crosses to the area o the floor where Kay Connell's files are still spread out. Starts pressing the floorboards with the toe of his boot. Testing.  Testing.  Until...he finds the one that SQUEAKS Gets down on his knees.  Hesitates.  Then jams his finger around the loose board.  Starts pulling it up.  Face reddening.  Knuckles whitening.  Slips his hand into the Pulls out a muddy 357 RUGER. The killer's gun. Will, stares down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, standing at the mouth of the ALLEY.  Just like the night before.  Steps inside.  Cautious.  Eyes darting. Peering into the shadows for the HOMELESS MAN... Not there.  Coast's clear.  Heads for the dumpster at the of the alley.  Shoves it aside.  Looks down at... The DEAD DOG.  Rancid.  Rotting.  Will gags.  Holds a handkerchief to his face.  Waving away the flies. Then.  Pulls the 357 Ruger from his pocket.  Shrugs his c off and wraps it around his hand and the gun.  Looks away Fires a muffled SHOT into the dog's side.  The body kicks Crouches down.  Feels along the dog's ribs for the bullet point of entry.  Finds it.  Pulls out a PENKNIFE and exte one of the blades.  Cuts into the gash, fingers probing d for the lodged bullet.  He finds it.  Pulls it out. Looks back at the dog.  Takes a deep breath.  Wipes his b A little smear of the dog's blood left on his forehead. Turns and pulls a bottle of RUBBING ALCOHOL from his pock Douses the bullet.  Cleaning it.  Glancing at his watch. Running out of time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rear of the Nightmute PD building.  Will, looking aro heads briskly for the back door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...steps into the HALLWAY leading towards the bullpen.  H VOICES.  Nearby.  Ducks back.  Waiting for them to fade. Safe.  Heads down towards the STORAGE ROOM.  Glancing bri at the PICTURES hanging on the wall.  Of old time POLICE OFFICERS.  Striking brave poses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storage room.  Hot.  Stifling.  The moose antlers LOO over his shoulder.  Will pulls the evidence locker key fr his pocket.  Unlocks the padlock.  Swings the door open. Pulls the Hap Eckhart envelope out.  Throwing a look over shoulder.  Opens it.  Shakes out the bullet that was lodg in Hap's spine.  Then fishes a plastic bag from his pocke The bullet he shot into the dead dog.  Drops that into th envelope and reseals it.  Hands shaking. Something.  Catches the corner of his eye.  He turns. HIS REFLECTION in the locker mirror.  The blood smear sti on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dormer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will jumps.  Quickly wipes the smear off and turns.  Fred Duggar standing behind him.  RICH by his side.  Will clea his throat, shoves Hap's envelope into Fred's hand.  Then Farrell's.  Angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These should have gone out two hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAMS the locker door and brushes past him.  Fred and Ric exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a YOUNG GIRL's face.  Dark hair held up in two barrettes, wind tousling the curls.  Reading from a piece paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And that's how I think Kay would want us to remember her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal Kay Connell's funeral.  PEOPLE standi by the grave, most of them HIGH SCHOOLERS.  The sky's a brilliant blue.  Red fireweeds blanket the hillside. YOUNG GIRL (cont'd) ...Swimming, reading, hiking through the Kebaughs...

dialogues.speaker: FRED, ELLIE AND WILL
dialogues.text: stand off to the side.  Dressed in black.  Fred looks lik he's never worn a tie before.  Ellie holds a potted plant gift for the bereaved. YOUNG GIRL (cont'd) ...playing her flute, meeting at Darrow's after school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.  Eyes bloodshot.  Not really listening.  Not really paying attention.  A thousand miles away.  Tugs at his collar.  Feels tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And always, always with a smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl looks up.  Folds the paper closed.  People SNIFFLE.  Mrs. Connell, reaches out to squeeze her arm. Some CHILDREN.  Start circulating with plastic buckets. Filled with white carnations.  Handing them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, startled, looks down.  A LITTLE GIRL stands before Curly hair.  Glasses.  Holding up a bucket.  He shakes hi head.  Looks back up at THE MOURNERS lining up to place the carnations on Kay's casket. AN OLD MAN with a brass-tipped cane.  Two GIRLS, look lik sisters, holding each other up.  A MAN with a thick red beard.  A LITTLE BOY, about five, clutching a FLUTE tied a pink ribbon... Will, looks away.  Then.  At the end of the line.  Someth catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY STETZ
dialogues.text: in tight jeans and a down vest.  In front of him stands a GIRL with white-blonde hair. From the torn pictures in Kay Connell's room. Will, straightens at the sight of her. Sees Randy surreptitiously caress her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service is over.  People are heading back to their ca Fred yanks off his tie.  Looks at Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go say hello to Mrs. Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts off.  Ellie, looks back at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go ahead.  I'll be there in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie nods.  Catches up to Fred.  Will turns his attentio back to RANDY AND THE GIRL.  Over at the far end of the  cemetery.  Standing next to Randy's motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gets on his bike, strapping his helmet on.  The gir about to get on behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I give her a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look over.  WILL walking towards them.  The wind whipping his jacket.  His tie.  Randy makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought I smelled something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, too, Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will arrives at the bike.  The girl, TANYA FRANCKE, looks him curiously.  Her long white-blonde hair, her skin almo translucent.  Something sexy about her.  Has the carnatio stuck in the buttonhole of her jean jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who're you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred shakes Mrs. Connell's hand.  Ellie waits.  Looks ove and sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL standing with Tanya and Randy. Shifts the plant in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shows the gold shield on his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy kick starts the bike.  It dies.  He kicks it again. Calls out over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight dappling through tall fir trees.  Will drives. Tanya sitting next to him.  Her black skirt riding up. Picking at the flaking polish on her nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never met anyone from Seattle before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not missing much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in this shit-hole town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, shifts.  Looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were good friends with Kay Connell, weren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya hesitates.  Pulls a cigarette from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was her best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since grade school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were like sisters.  Knew everything about each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be tough for you.  What happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya shrugs.  Lights the cigarette.  Takes a drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody says I'm holding up great, considering.  Don't even care if I go to school.  They're all worried I haven't cried yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stretches.  Her midriff showing.  Shifts her body tow Will. TANYA (cont'd) But there's no law against not crying, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Kay's other friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya makes a face.  Reaches out and taps the hula-girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to talk about Kay?  I don't want to talk about her right now.  Let's just drive.  Go somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks over at her.  She blows out a plume of smoke. Smiles.  Seductive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to take you somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long as it's fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out a sinewy arm.  Starts massaging the back Will's neck. TANYA (cont'd) Young, impressionable girl left alone with older, Seattle detective.  Who knows what we could get up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, impervious to the touch.  Head, throbbing.  Reaches the gear.  His foot, pressing harder on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREECH!  The Cherokee whips around a curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya giggles.  Likes the speed.  Will, goes even faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee breaks free from the forest.  Racing along a coastal road.  Water CRASHING against the rocks. Up ahead, a LOGGING TRUCK coming the other way.  The Cher shifts lanes.  Heading straight for the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya looks out at the truck.  Still giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this.  You like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck BEEPS.  Will goes faster.  Tanya takes her hand from Will's neck.  Holds on to her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gap's closing fast.  The truck BEEPS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya looks over at Will.  Not giggling any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you wanted something fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will goes even faster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck and the Cherokee.  On a collision course.  The truck BEEPS wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya squirming in her seat.  Not liking this any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will staring dead ahead.  Tensing his jaw.  The TRUCK... bearing down on them... Tanya reaches for the wheel...Will pushes her hands away. The TRUCK...a breath away... TANYA (cont'd) (screaming) Move over, you crazy fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck and the Cherokee...just feet from each other... the last moment...the Cherokee jerks out of the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...SCREECHES to a stop near an old sign, Icicle Cannery. Gravel flying.  Will gets out.  Slams his door.  Rounds t car and opens Tanya's door.  She's screaming at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy son-of-a-bitch!  You could have killed us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will reaches in and pulls her out of the car. TANYA (cont'd) Ow!  You're hurting me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls her up a steep hill of garbage and broken crat Pushes her down the other side.  She stumbles. TANYA (cont'd) You want to tell me what the fuck this is all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands above her, on the hill.  His face set like st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Kay were like sisters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told each other everything. (heads down the hill) That why your picture's torn up in the top drawer of her bureau?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya steps back. WILL (cont'd) Why her boyfriend's hand was clamped on  your ass at her funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her by the arm.  Jerks it up.  She CRIES out.  W leans in. WILL (cont'd) You like games, little girl?  Well how about this one - you're standing right where her naked body was found wrapped up in a garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya's eyes grow wide.  She looks around her.  Disgustin rotten.  A SEAGULL pecking at the body of a dead bird.  S tries to break away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was Kay seeing besides Randy Stetz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya looks away. WILL (cont'd) Who gave her those dresses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles more.  No good.  Will's grip is like a vice WILL (cont'd) I need a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wouldn't tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were such good friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya, squirming.  Angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like some big fucking secret!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kept saying she was gonna get out of here.  Leave us all behind.  That he was going to take her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My arm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She used some stupid code name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody...I don't know... (crying) ...Something Brody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will straightens.  He's heard that name before. Suddenly Tanya jams her heel into his shoe.  He CRIES out She breaks away from him.  Runs up the hill.  Turns.  Tea streaking her face.  Throws the carnation to the ground. TANYA (cont'd) You happy now, you fucking bastard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a FINGER.  Running along a row of book spines. Brundt...Buckley...Buss...Buckham...Byrie... PULL BACK to reveal will in Nightmute's small bookstore. Still in his funeral clothes. In the "Mystery!" section.  Not finding what he wants.  T something catches his eye:  A BARGAIN BIN at the end of t aisle.  Will limps down to it.  Avoides eye-contact with YOUNG WOMAN shelving "New Arrivals!" Reaches into the bin.  Rummages through some paperbacks. Then he finds it:  Otherwise Engaged by Walter Byrd. Underneath the title, he finds what he's looking for: Another J. Brody Mystery.  Flips to the inside of the cov A BLURRY PICTURE of Walter Byrd.  Head turned to the side Walter Byrd was born in Watson Lake, Canada.  He graduate Will's eyes skip down to the bottom: Mr. Byrd currently lives in Umkumiut, Alaska, with his tw labrador retrievers, Lucy and Desi. Will looks up.  Slaps the book closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will drives, sipping take-out coffee.  Trying to fight th stinging in his eyes.  Passes a sign:  Umkumiut, 30 miles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands in a phone booth at the gas station.  Flips through the phone book.  His finger tracing down the "B"s Finds it:  Walter Byrd, 451 S. Diamond Tooth, Apt. B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sky's become overcast.  Will stands across the street fro pale blue building.  On the ground floor, a tackle store. Above, looks like several apartment units. He starts across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads down a narrow hallway.  Tiled floor.  Passes d "A."  Stops at the next one, "B."  Knocks.  Hears nothing the muted tv from apartment "A."  Pulls out his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a CLICK the door swings open.  Will, gloves on, pock his credit card.  Hears the CHING CHING of dog collars as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO LABRADOR RETRIEVERS stand at attention, GROWLING.  Wi prepared.  Takes a bag of treats from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy.  Desi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs break.  Trot over to him.  Wolf down the treats. Will scans the place.  Small, cheap.  Matching sofa and e chair, corduroy upholstery.  The walls, lined with old 19 movie posters.  All second-rate detective movies:  "Anoth Shot in the Dark," "Lady Luck," "He wore a Black Hat." Will walks across the room.  Repulsed.  The pathetic hove a killer.  Looks into the

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Single bed.  Books and magazines.  A half-eaten tuna sand on the bedside table.  "NYPD BLUE" calendar on the wall. It's quiet.  He walks over to a large DESK by the window. Scattered papers.  Computer.  Mini cassette recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wall, hundreds of newspaper articles.  Some yellow some fresh.  All about cops: "Officer Louis Saved My Life "Shoot-out in Soho," "South Street Cop Takes Down Drug Ring," "Seattle Cop Killed by Suspect..." Will curls his lip.  Starts looking through the papers on desk.  Underneath a stack, he finds an 8x10 PHOTOGRAPH. of Byrd, standing in front of a big, lakeside HOUSE.  A R TOWER in the background.  Walter Byrd's face is blurred, turned to the side.  The photo from the book bio. Will takes it.  Starts roughly opening drawers.  A box of animal crackers, a rubber band ball.  Then, shoved in the back of the top drawer, an APPOINTMENT BOOK.  Will flips through to today's date.  Blank.  Shoves the book into hi pocket.  Slams the door closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then reaches back for his Smith 39/13.  Checks the magazi Slaps it back in place.  He's ready. SUDDENLY the phone RINGS.  A beige rotary on the desk. Plugged into an ancient answering machine.  It RINGS agai The answering machine WHIRS.  Then BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're mad at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will freezes. WALTER'S VOICE (cont'd) ...I spotted your car around the corner. You must have been in a hurry.  Put some pieces together.  Don't worry, I would have done the same thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns back to the window.  Looking furiously... WALTER'S VOICE (cont'd) Anyway... (blows nose) ...I'm not coming home.  So you shouldn't wait there all day.  I mean, they'll wonder about you at the station. You should be careful about following procedure, Will, especially now that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will lunges for the phone.  Snatches it up just as CLICK! tape cuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, he PUNCHES the receiver through the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will exits the apartment.  Cradling his hand.  Looks down the tile floor.  Scanning it for a broken tile.  Finds on Bends down and plucks out a broken corner. Places it carefully where the bottom of the door meets th door jamb.  Just then.  His BEEPER goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will strides into the bullpen.  Wounded hand in pocket. Ellie hunts and pecks at a typewriter.  Glances up. Fred, over in the corner.  SLAMS a drawer in the filing cabinet.  Turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget your pager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beeped you over two hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holds out a one-page report. FRED (cont'd) Got a fax from the lab.  Murder weapon was a 357 Ruger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes the report.  Heads over to the coffee machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And something else that might interest  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his desk drawer and pulls out a book.  Ho it up.  Otherwise Engaged.  In hardback. FRED (cont'd) Remember this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the paperbacks we found in Kay Connell's knapsack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pours himself a cup of coffee.  Trying to keep the stream steady.  Ellie continues typing...CLACK...CLACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Connell found this copy in the  house. (opens it up) It's signed.  Personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a local writer.  Kay had all his books.  I think we should check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLACK...CLACK...CLACK...Will rubs his chin.  Looks back a the report.  Judicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it'll lead anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLACKING stops.  SILENCE.  Will turns around.  Ellie' staring right at him - that isn't like him. He turns back to Fred.  Beat. WILL (cont'd) Well.  If he's local.  Give him a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLACKING resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark stairway.  Late at night.  Will, bathed in shadows Climbs to the top.  Quietly, carefully.  He heads down a hallway.  We recognise it.  Back where Walter Byrd lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will approaches apartment "B."  Slowly pulls out his weap Cocks it.  Waits a beat then swings out in front of the d Ready to fight.  Ready to confront.  Looks down... Tile corner's still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Walter Byrd's APPOINTMENT BOOK laying open. Scrawled in pencil:  8:30.  Dr. Agee. PULL BACK to reveal Will sitting in the parked Cherokee. appointment book on the passenger seat.  Been there all n Insomnia.  Taking its toll.  His hair, no longer neatly combed.  His face, pale and unshaven.  His eyes, dragged from fatigue.  Looks like the whole world's pulling him d Staring down the street at a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRICK BUILDING on the corner.  A placard by the front doo Dr. Florence Agee, D.D.S. Will checks his watch.  Rubs his eyes with the heels of h hands.  Suddenly.  Something tells him to look up.

dialogues.speaker: A MAN
dialogues.text: in the distance, walking along the road.  Towards Dr. Age He's in his forties.  Short, shoulders sloped.  Wears a  beige, zip-up windbreaker, khakis, brown desert boots.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER BYRD
dialogues.text: has a bulky hearing aid in one ear.  Is looking down at t road.  Glances up.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKS EYES WITH WILL
dialogues.text: Byrd, slows his pace. Will, reaches for the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: Byrd turns in the other direction, starts walking fast. Will leaps out of the Cherokee and heads after him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER BYRD
dialogues.text: his short legs pumping, spots a TOUR BUS across the road. Veers over to it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: a runner's stride.  Weaves through PEOPLE.  Closing in on Byrd.  Sees his plan.  Cuts across the road just as...

dialogues.speaker: A PICK-UP
dialogues.text: rounds the corner.  THUMP!  Broadsides him.  Will's pitch up and over the hood.  Falls hard on the tarmac.  Dazed f second.  Blood, gushing from his forehead.  Hears the PIC DOOR open...FEET running over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?  You popped out from nowhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More FEET running over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens his eyes.  Trying to focus.  Looks up and sees the distance...WALTER BYRD getting on the tour bus. Will struggles to his feet.  The OLD LADY who hit him, wearing overalls.  Reaches out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you should move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands, wavering.  Flashes her his badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old lady rips along in the truck.  Will sits in the passenger seat, a handkerchief to his forehead.  It's soa with blood.  The lady looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful not to bleed on my interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks over at her.  Shifts in his seat.  Ouch.  Feel like a couple cracked ribs.  Peers out the windshield at TOUR BUS a few cars ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL VIEW of the pick-up tailing the tour bus.  A windy coastal road.  Beyond it, a blanket of endless evergreens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FERRY at the end of the pier.  A small wooden booth for selling tickets.  Beautiful, sweeping snow-capped mountai on the other side of the bay.  Nothing else for miles aro The pick-up pulls up next to the bus and a couple other c Will jumps out.  Scans the area for Byrd.  Nothing.  Then sees the last few PEOPLE boarding the ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferry's getting pitched around in the roiling water.  Mos everyone is inside.  TOURISTS with throw-away cameras, backpacks, anoraks, CHILDREN.  Some looking sea-sick in t corner. Will weaves through the crowd.  Eyes darting, searching. ferry lurches to one side, the crowd sways, Will spots WALTER BYRD standing by a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter holds on to the railing.  Looking at the view, the spray.  Will comes up.  Stands next to him.  Cognizant of people around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Byrd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter continues looking out the window.  That same stuff nose voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was seven my mother and grandmother took me to Vancouver.  We were walking along the street one day when these two men ran past and snatched my grandmother's purse right from under her arm.  Right from under her arm.  That night a police officer came to our hotel  room to ask us questions.  Stood the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferry pitches again.  Will grabs on to the railing. Looking down at this little man.  Hate in his eyes. WALTER (cont'd) His uniform looked brand new.  His shoes and badge were polished, his billy club, his belt buckle.  All perfect.  He was like a soldier, but better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter reaches up to blow his nose.  Will's eyes look on disgust - his knuckles are still red and swollen.  From beating Kay Connell to death. WALTER (cont'd)  Made a huge impression on me.  His goodness.  Gave me an instant respect for the police.  I tried to become a cop when I left high school, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to his hearing-aid. WALTER (cont'd) Congenital problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferry's engine HUMS to a stop.  Walter smiles. WALTER (cont'd) Oh.  We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gendreau Glacier.  Spilling down between two huge mountai Enormous in its whiteness, its coldness, its silent power Will and Walter walk up its face, away from the other tourists.  Walter leads the way.  Hands in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this glacier moves a quarter of an inch every day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points off to the horizon. WALTER (cont'd) And on a clear day you can see all the way over to Newtok.  There's a beautiful aviary over there.  We can go sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's lip curls.  Watching him. WALTER (cont'd) It's actually cool for this time of year. Normally the temperature runs about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY Will lunges at him.  Walter's eyes widen in surp as he grabs him up by the collar.  Nose to nose.  Will ba keeping control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is a nice meeting we're  having here?  Friendly?  Two people getting acquainted? (jerks him harder) You sick, coward, fuck.  I get up every morning of my life just to bring someone like you down.  Beating a seventeen year- old girl to death.  Washing her afterwards, cleaning her.  Make you feel like a real man? (tightens his grip) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter flounders. WILL (cont'd) I outta end this right now.  Take a rock and smash your fucking skull in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His jaws tense, nostrils flare.  Walter, red-faced, sputtering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stood right behind you...I saw you look right into his eyes and shoot him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will clenches his teeth. WALTER (cont'd) ...Seattle's great hero.  Shooting his own partner.  I saw it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was an accident!  You hear me?  I didn't know it was him! (shakes him hard) I didn't know it was him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a SHRIEK.  Will looks over A COUPLE KIDS.  Further down the glacier.  Having a snowb fight. Will looks back at Walter.  Has to take it easy.  Shoves away in disgust.  Walter falls down onto the snow.  Dislo his hearing aid. Watches Will pace.  Head throbbing.  Ribs, screaming in p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why lie about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter brushes the snow off the dislodged hearing aid.  P it back around his ear. WALTER (cont'd) I mean, I'm all for bending the truth. That's what I do in my novels.  It's my  trade you might say.  But why cover it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets up.  Brushes the snow from his butt.  Checks somethi in his pocket. WALTER (cont'd) You don't have to tell me if you don't want to.  I'm sure you have some reason. Something noble.  I have faith in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks down at the kids.  Shakes his head. WALTER (cont'd) They should be bundled up better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your game, Byrd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone call.  The knapsack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured we're partners on this one.  I mean, after what I saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stops short.  Eyes burning.  It's all he can do not throttle this weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get one thing straight, Byrd.  We are partners on nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at him.  Scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I research my novels.  I know the  procedures.  You'd have cuffed me back at the ferry.  You'd have called for back- up, read me my rights, and gotten a search warrant for my apartment.  You're a well-respected detective.  There's no reason for you to be talking to me right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a handkerchief.  Blows his nose. WALTER (cont'd) ...except that we could help each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stares at him. WALTER (cont'd) So.  We're at an impasse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will runs his hands through his hair.  Half-crazed.  Hear pounding.  Turns to watch... THE KIDS down the glacier.  Making angels in the snow.  T GIGGLES carried along by the wind. Will, squeezes his eyes shut.  Trapped.  About to defy ev instinct in his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) You're going to get a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter steps up, tapping his hearing aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you're going to get a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perks up) Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay Connell had a signed copy of one of your books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you might find that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be brought in for questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter smiles.  Pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down at the station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hisses) Yes down at the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter rubs his hands together.  Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Okay.  Brought in for questioning. Good.  I can write this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST THEN the ferry blows its HORN.  Low and loud.  Walte looks down at it. WALTER (cont'd) Ferry's leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts down.  Will watches him pass, has no choice but follow.  Walter, going over the details in his head. WALTER (cont'd) Something to divert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snaps his fingers.  An idea. WALTER (cont'd) My gun.  You still have my gun, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will nods.  Walter smiles.  Spreads out his hands. WALTER (cont'd) Then that's the wild card.  Every detective story has a wild card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "wild card?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOURISTS.  Boarding the ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next ferry's in forty-five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter heads over to the ramp.  Will stops, grabbing his side.  A PANG through his ribs.  Excruciating.  Calls out Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "wild card?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks back.  Waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll know.  At the questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives his ticket to the TICKET TAKER.  Gets on.  Walks ba to the stern.  Looks out at Will.  The HORN sounds again. Walter, at the rail.  Smiles.  The ferry's engine, churni up water.  Starting forward just as... Walter takes a MINI CASSETTE RECORDER from his pocket.  H it up for Will to see. Will, on shore, sees it.  A cold flash ripping through hi body.  That motherfucker.  Bolts through some tourists towards the ramp but... A couple of GUYS are just pulling it in.  The Ticket Take grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Will) Full up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, jerks his arm away.  Stares off at the ferry.  Walt Byrd and his tape recorder.  Receding into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a counter top.  Stuff thrown down.  Aspirin.  Ba aids.  Gauze.  Medical tape.  First aid cream.  Back pill Sleeping pills.  Bottle of scotch. PULL BACK to reveal Will standing at the counter in the convenience store.  His entire body aching.  The CASHIER, throws him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will exits the store.  A bag under his arm.  We Miss You, looming over his shoulder.  Steps out onto the sidewalk a sees... ELLIE leaning against her truck.  Waiting for him.  Smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way are you walking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tingle, all across Will's body.  Christ.  This girl's everywhere!  He hunches into his coat.  Flicks up his col Doesn't want her to see him fully.  Nods down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the Lodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie grabs her bag.  Joins him.  They start walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed to get your signature on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a folder from her bag. ELLIE (cont'd) The report on Detective Eckhart.  Chief made me finish it this morning.  Said it was taking too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes the file.  Flips it open.  The death of his partner.  Neatly typed.  Neatly stapled.  Pulls out a pen ELLIE (cont'd) Aren't you going to read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signs.  Hands it back to her.  She slips it into her b ELLIE (cont'd) Now I can help you with the Connell case.  That writer's coming in tomorrow.  Walter Byrd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slight stutter in Will's step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duggar called him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About an hour ago.  Said he was more than happy to cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie looks over at Will as they cross the street.  Study his face.  His gait.  Noticing the slight limp in his rig leg.  The cut on his forehead. ELLIE (cont'd) You haven't been sleeping much, have you, Detective Dormer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the stone steps of the Pioneer Lodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that the difference between a good cop and a bad cop?  A good cop can't sleep 'cause a piece of the puzzle's missing.  A bad cop can't sleep 'cause his conscience won't let him. (smiles) You said that once, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, finally looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But it sounds like something I would've said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns and starts up the steps. WILL (cont'd) See you tomorrow, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, watches him for a second.  Then calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  I forgot to tell you.  The Puffins won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stops, turns to look back at her.  Confused. ELLIE (cont'd) The baseball game.  Our team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slings the bag over her shoulder. ELLIE (cont'd) ...We won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clock flicks to 3:00 A.M.  Will, pacing in his room.  Shi off.  Rib cage wrapped in a bandage.  Looking through... A STACK OF MESSAGES.  All from John Warfield.  He discard them one by one.  Can barely focus... SUDDENLY the phone RINGS.  He lunges for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing it) Listen to me, you son-of-a-bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrupted by a CLICK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I saw you look right into his eyes and shoot him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Byrd's voice.  Recorded from that afternoon. RECORDED VOICE (cont'd) ...Seattle's great hero.  Shooting his own partner.  I saw it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, hears his own voice... RECORDED VOICE (cont'd) That was an accident!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Byrd!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, another clumsy CLICK.  Walter Byrd gets on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have done the same thing, Will.  I know you would...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Will SLAMS down the receiver.  Then again.  And again.  Y the cord out of the wall and HURLS the phone across the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The DARK FIGURE.  Disappearing back into the fog.  Clo in around him like milky water... We whip out our SMITH 39/13...plunge in after him...takin chase...BREATHING hard...leaping from rock to rock...the blanket thick...tightening around us... Our feet.  Hit water.  Up to our ankles.  Icy cold.  We run...sloshing through...when...

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: A DARK FIGURE.  Appears ahead.  Big and hulking...CRASHIN towards us... We raise our weapon...quick as a flash...as the FIGURE emerges... And in a split second... WE LOCK EYES WITH FIGURE's - his eyes, brown and gentle.. CRACK!  We fire!  The FIGURE grips his gut, falls into th water. Heart POUNDING.  Adrenaline PUMPING.  We slosh towards th body.  Something...catching our eye...

dialogues.speaker: A 357 RUGER
dialogues.text: lying in the rocks.  Off to the side.  We grab it.  Turn to the body... And stop cold. That's when it hits us.  That's when we realize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will bolts up.  White as a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His body, drenched in sweat.  His breathing, quick and ragged.  Caught up in the twisted sheets of his bed.  Loo across the room and sees

dialogues.speaker: HAP
dialogues.text: sitting in the corner.  Eating an apple with a penknife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.  Sympathetic.  Looks over at the window just a The BLANKET.  Drops to the floor.   LIGHT floods the room. INT. WILL'S ROOM - 4:02 A.M. With a GRUNT Will puts his back into it.  Shoving the hea oak bureau towards the window.  Sweat beading his face. A...few...more...shoves.  And the bureau finally stands i front of the window.  WIll stands back to take a look.  O covers half of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red-faced, Will leans into the wooden armoire.  Shimmying towards the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie.  Sitting in her truck.  Parked behind the Pioneer Lodge.  Rubbbing her eyes.  Sleepy.  Looking up at

dialogues.speaker: WILL'S WINDOW
dialogues.text: concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one last heave, Will gets the armoire to the window. Light still shining through the cracks. INT. WILL'S ROOM - 4:50 A.M. Will shoving magazines, blankets, sheets, pillows.  Anyth To fill the cracks.  To cover the light.  His eyes.  Like crazy man's... SUDDENLY a knock on the door.  Will turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel standing out in the hallway.  Will opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled by his appearance) Will...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a guy down the hall.  Complaining about the noise. (beat) Says he can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will gives a half-smile.  Fucking irony.  Heads back into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his room.  Rachel follows.  Looks around at the mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grabs up a sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads back over to the window.  Rachel now notices all stuff piled up.  Softens her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did something happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.  Cramming the sweater into a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel walks up behind him.  His cramming, more desperate More urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light.  It keeps coming in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel reaches out.  Catches his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops.  Looks down at her hand. RACHEL (cont'd) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will suddenly realises what he's doing.  Absurd.  Patheti Pitiful.  Slowly turns to face Rachel. Her eyes, looking up at him.  His shoulders droop. Exhausted.  Rachel reaches up.  Catches him in her arms. Strong arms.  Caring.  Will buries his face in her neck. Wants to be swallowed up. Rachel holds him.  Arms encircling.  Will breathes her in Sweet, soft, safe. Looks up.  His mouth suddenly finding hers.  A kiss, hung urgent.  His arms move to surround her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Rachel in bed.  Spooning.  Rachel behind will, h finger tracing his scar.  Rain DRUMS against the window. Will.  Watching the raindrops streaming down the glass. Casting strange shadows against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this guy named Weston Dobbs. Twenty-four.  Worked as a part-time stock boy in a copy store.  Every morning he'd sit at the only window in his apartment and watch an eight year-old boy get picked up by his carpool across the street.  And every afternoon he'd watch the boy get dropped off again.  He did this for about six months.  Until one day he got up the nerve to cross the street and grab the boy before his carpool came. Kept him in his apartment for three days. Tortured him.  Raped him.  Made him do things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will tenses his jaw.  Rachel, listens in horror. WILL (cont'd) When he was done, he got a rope and a kitchen stool and hanged the boy in the basement of the apartment building.  But he didn't do a good enough job.  The little boy's neck didn't break and he died from shock.  The landlord found him five days later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel reaches for Will's hand.  Squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of your cases?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Hap.  A year and a half ago.  I knew the second I met Dobbs that he was guilty.  Smug, cold.  Dead eyes.  We had circumstantial evidence, but nothing to tie him to it.  Nothing concrete.  Went over every inch of that apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns slowly over to face her.  Her hair, splayed ou the pillow.  Her cheeks, flushed.  Her eyes, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took some blood samples from the boy's body and planted them in his apartment. (beat) Arrested him the next day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks at him.  Goose pimples on her arms.  Realisi the weight of the confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There've been other cases.  Where we've changed results.  Pushed witnesses. Manipulated evidence. (rubs his face) But Dobbs.  I wanted Dobbs more than anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up.  Abrupt.  Wincing from the pain in his ribs. Rests his arms on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if someone finds out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're under investigation now.  Back in Seattle. (beat) Hap wanted to talk.  As soon as we got back.  Thought he could work out some kind of deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel rubs his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's not going to happen now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will closes his eyes.  The rain, PATTERING.  Rhythmic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it was wrong?  What we did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a PAUSE.  Rachel, studying Will's back.  The cuts The bruises.  Not sure how to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two kinds of people in Alaska.  Those who were born here and those who've come here to escape something in their lives. (beat) I wasn't born here, Will.  I'm in no position to judge anyone.  I'm not about that any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks out the window. RACHEL (cont'd) It's all about what you're willing to live with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock reads 6:00.  Will pulls on his trousers.  Goes strap on his Smith 39/13 holster.  Grimaces with pain.  L at his back in the full-length mirror.  BLACK BRUISES see out from under his bandage. Puts the 39/13 and holster in the top drawer of the burea Turns and looks down at Rachel.  Sleeping soundly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were acquainted with the deceased, Kay Connell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will in the interrogation room.  Standing by the window. Tensed jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I was.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER BYRD
dialogues.text: sits at the table.  Hair combed, wet.  Shirt newly starch A Styrofoam cup of coffee in front of him.  Playing the p Fred sits opposite him.  Report file open.  Ellie, next t Fred.  Taking notes.  She's combed her hair, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In what manner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter smiles modestly.  Looks over at Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was, not quite a "fan."  More an avid reader of my detective novels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you first meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred shoots Ellie a look.  She closes her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year ago.  At one of my signings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie hands Fred the hardback of Otherwise Engaged.  He h it up.  Opened to the signature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you signed this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened at that signing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flattered me about my writing.  Asked if she could visit me.  To talk about my books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Not that much at first.  But then she became more comfortable.  Started  visiting me every week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, from over by the window.  Interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the nature of your relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks over.  Wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, Detective Dormer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns.  Accusatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was an attractive girl.  Did you have sex with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was only seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she was an attractive girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have sex with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred shoots Will a look.  Ellie, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a mentor to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads over to Walter's chair.  Fists clenched in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave her gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expensive dresses.  A heart necklace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't sound like a mentor to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave her things she didn't have. Couldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Fred and Ellie. WALTER (cont'd) Her family lives on Mr. Connell's disability.  It isn't much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred stops Will with a look.  Had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand, Mr. Byrd. (to Will) You want to sit down, Detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense BEAT.  Will stares at Walter.  Revulsion.  Heads ba over to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't happy.  I was someone to talk to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That boyfriend.  Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy Stetz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He.  Well, he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hesitates.  Takes a sip of coffee. WALTER (cont'd) I don't want to talk out of school.  Kay told me things in the strictest of confidence.  As a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Byrd.  Anything you can tell us could help out with this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter furrows his brow.  Taps his hearing aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  He hit her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie's eyes widen.  Fred glances at Will.  But Will's to busy watching this little man weave his web.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd come to me, sometimes in the middle of the night.  Bruises all over her back, her upper arms.  I pled with her to let me call the police, but she wouldn't hear it.  Wanted to keep it a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy Stetz beat Kay Connell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks right at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a terrible rage.  Kay even said he carried a handgun around with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred stands.  This is big.  Calls out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret!  Get Judge Biggs on the phone! (to Will) I'll get another warrant for Stetz's place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes a sip of his coffee.  Cup's empty.  Holds it to Ellie.  Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have some more coffee, Detective Burr?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie nods, takes the cup.  Heads over to the coffee mach Fred turns back to the door... AND AT THAT MOMENT Walter levels a look right at Will. Mouths the words Wild Card. A shiver down Will's spine.  Wild card.  The gun.  Randy.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: over at the coffee machine.  Pouring coffee.  Glances up the window.  Catches the reflection of the two men. An intense look between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a BOOT.  Jumping down onto a black rock. PULL BACK to reveal Ellie walking out on the beach.  Head down towards the water.  Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark, narrow boarding room.  A HAND reaches through an window.  Feels for the lock on the door.  CLICK. Will enters Randy Stetz's place.  Cigarette butts, electr guitar, Hustler centerfolds tacked on the walls. He looks around.  Every inch of him revolting against wha he's about to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of waves.  A slight breeze.  Ellie walking alon the water. Looking down.  Brow furrowed.  Stops and puts her hands o her hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads over to a hanging sheet on the other side of t room.  Pulls it aside.  A MOTORBIKE being repaired.  Part and tools all over the place. Pulls the 357 Ruger from his pocket with a handkerchief. Spots a COFFEE CAN on a shelf.  Filled with thick oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches Ellie's eye.  GLINTING from between the rocks.  She bends down.  Pulls a pencil from her backpack Spears something and holds it up. A SHELL CASING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, drops the 357 into the oil.  Turns and heads back across the room.  Hesitates.  At the door.  Turns back. Looking at the oil can.  Takes a step back towards it whe hears... The sound of a SQUAD CAR.  Pulling up outside. Too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands just outside the doorway into Randy's room. UNIFORMED OFFICERS inside searching the place.  Tearing d pictures.  Turning out doors.  Ripping up carpet.  Randy' voice.  In protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't fucking do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hears some SCUFFLING.  The sheet being pulled down. CLATTER of tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  I'm working on that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parts pulled off the shelves.  The bike, shoved to the si Then.  A SILENCE.  Followed by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shuts his eyes.  Heavy FOOTSTEPS head over to the bi Someone's pulled the gun from the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred's voice, calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  Let's bag it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More FOOTSTEPS.  Randy, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not mine, man!  That's not mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens his eyes.  Fred's voice.  Almost sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More SCUFFLING.  A chair knocked over.  Something SMASHES Will looks down at the floor as FRED AND A UNIFORMED COP struggle to drag Randy through t doorway.  Randy writhes, kicks, tugs.  Screams. RANDY (cont'd) That ain't mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred grabs Randy's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy squirms.  Turns.  Looks right into Will's eyes.  Go is the bluster.  Gone is the attitude.  Randy Stetz, lost kid.  Tears streaming down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God.  I didn't kill her.  I  swear to God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands outside the garage apartment.  Wind whipping coat.  Watches as a Nightmute PD SQUAD CAR pulls off with Randy Stetz in the back. Fred sees him, heads over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like shit, cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shifts his eyes to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an understatement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred half-smiles.  Watches the receding squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we can wrap this one up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will barely nods.  Fred pulls his baseball cap on. FRED (cont'd) We're getting together for a couple of beers later on.  Might not be the Seattle thing to do.  But you're welcome to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred puts out his hand to shake.  Truce.  Will looks at h Takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a tray of dark beer.  Five glasses, foam sloshin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it.  Randy Stetz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal Farrell, Rich, Francis, and Will sitt at a small, round table.  Fred's passing out the beers. bar.  MUSIC blaring.  3 a.m. Happy Hour! banner on the wa Place packed with rough-looking FISHERMEN. Rich takes a glass from Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you can't believe it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred sits.  Takes a sip of his beer.  To Farrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you grow up with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell shifts in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our dads were on the same boat. (to Will) We used to wait for them together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will nods.  Jostled by the crowd.  Reaches for his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to pick fights at the gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remember when he did all those donut holes that one summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Francis GUFFAW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a bad seed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell looks over at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like our beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
