dialogues.text: Will slams down his empty glass.  Squeezes his eyes open shut.  Loud music.  Cigarette smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred pats Will's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Detective Dormer needs is a little shut-eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white nights been hard on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't been easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis grabs a handful of peanuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have titanium shades over at the Pioneer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well no wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lose all sense of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than Fred's home town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns to Fred.  Wiping the foam from his moustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people are from Barrow.  Way up north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the winter there's no sunlight for five straight months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like being swallowed up in a black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up.  Ellie standing by their table.  Jeans, dow vest.  Hair tousled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy Drew!  Pull up a seat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear what happened, Ellie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rich found the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred leans back in his seat.  Eyeballs Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's on Nancy's mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie reaches into her vest pocket.  Pulls out a Ziploc w the SHELL CASING inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this out on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shell casing.  9mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, blanches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go, Ell.  We got the bad guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of us carries a 9mm duty weapon. And the murder weapon was a 357.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rich throws peanut shells at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a hobby, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie brushes off the shells.  Looks right at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a legitimate point, isn't it, Detective Dormer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to Will.  Their faces, spinning.  He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's legitimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worth pursuing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up.  Holds her gaze.  Then turns away.  Grabs th side of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The case is closed, Ellie. (gets up) I got the next round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys don't protest.  Will starts heading for the bar. Weaving through broad shoulders, massive backs.  Smoke. MUSIC.  Laughter.  Arguing.  A mass of bodies and sound. Like being swallowed up in a black hole... Looks back at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie's truck pulls up in front of a small house.  She ju out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM!  Ellie heads through the front door like a gust of wind.  Thunders up the stairs.  Calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, Pop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the TV in the other room.  An older MAN, Ellie's father, appears in the doorway.  Thick glasses, grey stub big paunch.  Wearing a flannel robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie?  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie appears at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's all my academy stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black, then, CLICK! as a bare lightbulb's switched Ellie stands beneath it.  Piles of crap everywhere. She steps through the quagmire of old bikes, fans, auto parts.  Over to a stack of cardboard BOXES in the corner. She nudges through them, reading the writing on the tops. thick black pen.  Shoves a couple aside. Then.  Finds what she's looking for.  Pulls down a box marked:  Ellie Acad.  Tears it open. INSIDE - piles of papers, polaroids of her and her FRIEND schedules, syllabi, handbooks.  Stuff from her Academy ye At the bottom, a report.  The title:  "Securing the Crime Scene," the Leland Street Murders.  By Eleanor P. Burr. Ellie pulls it out.  Sits down on an old stool.  Opens to middle of the report.  Her finger, tracing down the  typewritten page.  Flips to the next page.  Then the next The next.  Then.  She spots it. THREE-QUARTERS DOWN THE PAGE, her finger finds the sentence:...Detective Dormer's unregistered Smith and Wes model 39/13 9mm, to immobilize Langley... Ellie looks up.  Chews her bottom lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a huge wave CRASHING against a retaining wall. Spray flying. PULL BACK to reveal a small monument by the sea.  A stone cupola with a bronze statue underneath.  The sky, black w clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Byrd waits under the Mariner's Memorial.  Wind whipping his jacket, the green sea churning behind him. to a fifteen-foot statue of a SEAMAN, tall, rugged, tough Holding on to a thick coil of rope. Hunches against the wind.  Watches as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL approaches the monument.  Sonics sweatshirt, wrinkle coat.  Face drawn and haggard.  Angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Hi, Will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will enters the monument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing calling me at  the station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gust of wind WHORLS through the monument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured we should touch base.  Compare notes.  I think it went well.  What did you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's eyes pierce into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy Stetz is in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you I could write an ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will holds out his hand. WILL (cont'd) The tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at the open hand.  Hugs his jacket to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe we could talk some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing more to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we work so well together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will breaks.  Rushes Walter.  Slams him against one of th concrete pilasters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do nothing well together. (SLAMS him again) Nothing!  You understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another wave CRASHES.  Sprays them.  Walter looks up into Will's bloodshot eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You run on two settings, Will.  I've  noticed that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will tightens his grip. WALTER (cont'd) You jump from calm to rage in the blink of an eye.  That's okay.  I do that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the tape.  Will grabs it, shoves Walter to th side.  Yanks the tape out of the cassette.  Steps back an HURLS it into the sea.  Waves engulf it hungrily. Walter watches him. WALTER (cont'd) You're not sleeping, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay told me.  She comes to me, you know.    Tells me things.  About you.  About me.

dialogues.speaker: PAUSE.
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Does Detective Eckhart come to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will curls his fists. WALTER (cont'd) Does he ask you why you shot him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whips around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you that was an accident!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then so was mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you pull that shit with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to kill her, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steps closer to him.  Beseeching. WALTER (cont'd) When she called me that night from the party, she'd had a fight with Randy. Wanted to talk.  I told her to meet me at our special place.  The cabin at the beach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple RAVENS alight nearby.  Flapping their wings. SCREECHING into the wind. WALTER (cont'd) ...When she came she was barefoot.  And there was liquor on her breath.  I only wanted to comfort her.  To touch her. She could have at least let me do that. Her skin...it was like everything I'd ever written about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark shadow crosses his face.  Holds on to the coiled r of the statue.  Will hisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't get it up, Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was when I went to kiss her.  She started laughing.  I got angry.  After all I'd given her.  All I'd shared with her.  I just wanted to make her stop. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter.  Squeezing the bronze rope. WALTER (cont'd) From calm to rage in the blink of an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locks eyes with Will.  Conspiratorial. WALTER (cont'd) Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL'S HAND shoots out.  Clamps around Walter's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's face, starts turning red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This an accident, Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want it to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks deep into Walter's eyes.  Squeezing harder.  P hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took ten minutes to beat Kay Connell to death.  Ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes, locked.  Veins, popping along Walter's temple Lip quivering... JUST THEN a BELL sounds in the distance.  Will looks up. A LINE OF FISHING BOATS coming back in. Will, looks back at Walter.  Throws him to the ground. Sickened. WILL (cont'd) Get the fuck out of town, Byrd.  Leave and never come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter COUGHS.  Holding his neck.  Enjoying this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a summer house up by Kgun Lake. I'm going to write my next novel there. It's about a famous detective who goes bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shoots him a look. WALTER (cont'd) Just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls himself to his feet.  A little unsteady.  Takes a handkerchief.  Dabs his forehead. WALTER (cont'd) The never coming back part, though.  I'm not sure.  To tell you the truth this has been kind of fun.  Going to the station, meeting all those nice people.  Talking with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs.  Walks past Will. WALTER (cont'd) I might miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns.  Watches him walk away.  Walter hesitates.  T back. WALTER (cont'd) I especially like that new detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks at him.  Back straightening. WALTER (cont'd) Detective Burr. (smiles) I liked her very much.  Has a real vitality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's stomach jumps.  Walter turns back.  Continues on. The little man in a beige windbreaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a HAND.  Signing the bottom of a form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping not to send you back with so much paperwork, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal Chief Nyback sitting at his desk.  Wi stands before him.  Signing papers.  A bottle of bourbon the desk.  Some paper cups half filled. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) When are you taking off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, standing over by the filing cabinet.  Toothpick in mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Spencer's not too drunk to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyback chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't talk you into staying for a couple of days?  Do some fishing?  Show you what normally goes on around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks over at Fred picking his teeth. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) ...Brought some real class to the place. But, Seattle needs its hero back. (stands) Couldn't have done it without you, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will caps the pen.  Uncomfortable.  Nods towards Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had a lot of help from Nightmute's  finest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST THEN the door swings open.  They look over as ELLIE hurries in.  She smiles.  Looks tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't want to miss anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer's not leaving for a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could drive him to Spencer's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat.  Ellie walks over to Will.  Looks up. Suddenly throws her arms around him. ELLIE (cont'd) I thought what you did on this case was amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will holds his hands out.  Not sure what to do.  Looks do at the top of Ellie's head.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: slips down his back.  Feeling for a holster.  For that 39 Nothing.  She breaks away. ELLIE (cont'd) We're really going to miss you around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Will lock eyes.  Hold for a beat. He knows exactly what she was trying to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, driving down Nightmute's main street.  He takes a l Goes up a hill.  Glances out the window.  Passing by THE CEMETERY.  A cluster of headstones.  Something catche his eye.  He stops the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, walking up to the wrought-iron gate surrounding the cemetery.  Stops.  Puts his hands up to the bars.

dialogues.speaker: KAY CONNELL'S GRAVE
dialogues.text: on the other side.  Newly dug.  A mound of dirt.  Flowers scattered by the wind.  Daughter and Friend...1982-1999. Will.  Grips the bars.  As if he's seeing it for the firs time.  Really seeing it. Closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's REFLECTION in the mirror.  He's showered.  Hair's combed.  Put on a clean suit.  Steps back.  Smooths down lapels.  Just right. Turns to face the room.  Bed's made, mess cleaned up.  He heads over to the bureau, pulls out his Smith 39/13.  Lay on the bed. Unclips his badge from his belt.  Lays it on the bed.  Ta something from the bedside table.  The BULLET found in Ha Eckhart.  Lays it on the bed. All neat.  All ordered. Reaches under the mattress.  Pulls out the PHOTOGRAPH of blurry Walter Byrd standing in front of a house.  A radio tower in the background.  The call numbers: WKOZ. Will studies it.  Tears it in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel in the back room behind reception.  A pullman's kitchen, a desk, an old recliner.  Pouring some milk into bowl for a CAT.  A stray. Will walks in.  Rachel turns, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found a new friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks up to her.  Puts his arms around her.  Holds h smells her, kisses her neck.  Pulls away.  Looks into her eyes. RACHEL (cont'd) Will.  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer.  The cat, rubs against his leg.  PURRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will driving along a forest road.  Eyes dead ahead.  A ma the passenger seat.  By the fold, Kgun Lake circled in pe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie working at her desk.  Looks up at the clock: 6:00. Gets up, grabs her down vest.  Heads for the door.  Farre sticks the tip of his crutch in her path.  She stumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny, Farrell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL VIEW of the silver Jeep Cherokee.  The only car on road.  The sky, white-grey.  The trees, a blanket of gree The Cherokee heads around a hairpin curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel at reception.  Reading the paper.  Ellie walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, scanning the treeline.  Takes a left fork then stop Thought he saw something.  Grinds the gear, backs up.  Ta another look. IN THE DISTANCE, a radio tower.  WKOZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Ellie, standing outside Will's room.  Ellie kn again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have seen if he came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLICK of a key and the door opens.  Ellie strides in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.  Rachel behind her.  Taking in the strange fee in the room.  Walks over to the bed.  Eyes riveted on the 39/13.  On the bullet.  Rachel, behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, her mind races.  Notices TORN PHOTOGRAPH PIECES in trash can.  Reaches in and pulls some out.  A puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stops the car at the end of a narrow dirt driveway. Looming before him... A HOUSE right on the lake.  Tall, wooden, in disrepair. Chipping yellow paint.  A ghost of what it once was.  The house from the photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLANG of electric typewriter keys bang out a title: BLINK OF AN EYE, by Walter By WALTER BYRD hunched at his typewriter.  In an old study. Books stacked everywhere.  Light patches on the walls whe pictures used to hang. BARKING outside.  Walter cocks his head.  Gets up.  Walks over to the window.   OUTSIDE.  Will walking up to the house.  Lucy and Desi jumping around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens the screen door with a CREAK.  Steps into the living room. Recoils from the smell.  Flies BUZZING.  Yellow plastic covering the sofas.  Boxes, books, papers, pictures piled high everywhere.  Wallpaper faded, peeling. Everything, decaying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie ripping along the forest road in her truck.  Grippi the wheel.  The photograph pieces, taped together on the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads down a hallway.  Dark, narrow, floorboards wor More shit stacked up. Each step, careful, quiet.  Tracking.  Listening.  A BREE sweeps through.  The burned-out lightbulb hanging from th ceiling, starts swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here to visit me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will whips around. WALTER standing there.  At the other end of the hallway. Shoulders slumped. Will shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLIES, bouncing against the screen door. WILL (cont'd) I'm here to end this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your back-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No back-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not following procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Procedure went out the window a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the same side, Will.  You know that.  After what we've been through together.  We're partners.  Bound by a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes a step forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where you're wrong, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly reaches into his jacket... WILL (cont'd) There is no secret.  Because the biggest difference between you and me is what we will or will not live with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls out his SMITH AND WESSON.  Walter.  Looks at the gu Inches back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, darts out of sight.  Swings back into the doorw with a SHOTGUN... BAM!  Will's shoulder explodes with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, jumping out of her truck.  Hears the sound.  Looks at the big, yellow house.  Pulls out her Glock 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walking down the hall.  Will, writhing on the floo reaches for his back holster...gun's not there! Walter stands over him.  Swings his leg back and...CRACK! Kicks will in the ribs.  The pain, blinding.  Will GASPS. CRACK! again, CRACK! again, CRACK! again.  Walter's face. Calm, flushed.  A vein along his temple.   Will's eyes flutter.  Blood, spewing from his lips.  A TH to his kidneys.  Walter stops, out of breath.  Hand on hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give the police a bad name, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL'S HAND suddenly shoots out.  Grabs the shotgun barre WALTER stumbles back.  The shotgun goes off.  BAM!  Chunk ceiling rain down.  Walter falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, heart POUNDING.  Kicks the front door open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, covered in dry wall, struggling to his feet.  Reach for his Smith and Wesson. WALTER'S DESERT BOOT kicks it out of the way.  It SKITTER down the hall. Walter grabs his shotgun.  Scrambles to his feet.  Runs d to the end of the hall.  Ducks into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the library.  Dirty shelves, strings of dust.  Endless books.  He races over to a cabinet.  Yanks open a DRAWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, on his feet, trying to focus.  His suit, soaked wit blood.  Looking for his gun.  Spots it, in the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter jerks open another drawer.  A STACK OF BOOKS teete the top of the cabinet.  He finds what he needs.  SHELLS. Grabs a handful... THE BOOKS tumble down on top of him.  He CRIES out, cover his head...touches his ear, panics - hearing aid's gone! Looks up.  Will, coming down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hobbles into the library.  Sweeps the room with this No Walter. Steps on something, crushing it.  Looks down.  Walter's hearing aid.  Kicks it aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie.  In the front hall.  Following procedure.  Right h gripping the gun.  Left supporting the butt. Blinks away sweat.  Facing three doorways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will limps into the dining room.  Furniture stacked high. Eyes, darting.  Gun, covering.  Trying to stay conscious. BANG!  The screen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie.  Gun swinging.  Doorway one.  Doorway two.  Doorwa three...SUDDENLY

dialogues.speaker: A FIGURE
dialogues.text: runs past number one.  Big.  Shadowy.  The flash of a GUN She wheels toward it.  Finger on the trigger... SLO-MO...The FIGURE, passing.  Her heart, POUNDING.  Her finger...squeezing... Will Dormer or Walter Byrd? At the last second, she jerks the gun away.  The figure  disappears.  She swallows.  Gripping the gun.  Follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky, heavy with clouds.  The air, foreboding.  Will steals out the screen door.  Gun cocked.  Eyes scanning. Wind, bending the weeds, the trees. BAM! a shot.  Out of nowhere.  Rips into his thigh.  Will CRIES out.  BAM! a second shot.  Whizzes past him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...CRACK! the shot bites into the window frame.  Wings El halfway across the room.  She drops to the floor.  Clutch her shoulder.  Flesh wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls herself over to a SIDEBOARD for cover.  Shrinks beh it.  Notices A PLASTIC BAG sticking out from one of the drawers.  Nudg it open.  A flowered dress, some panty-hose, strands of l dark hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.  On the ground.  Gripping his leg.  Looking wildly around.  No sign of Walter.  Then.  He sees it. Lucy and Desi.  Down by the boathouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boathouse.  Old, rotted wood.  Crumbling beams. Walter stands at a window.  Re-loading his shotgun.  He fumbles, drops a shell.  It rolls towards a crack in the floor.  Falls into the LAKE WATER below. CLICK!  Walter levels the shotgun out the window. WALTER'S POV - the long, undulating WEEDS outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.  Pulling himself through the weeds.  Losing blood f Dragging his body.  Approaches the side of the BOATHOUSE. WALTER'S GUN BARREL, sticking out. Will ducks his head.  Winces in pain.  Breathing, becomin ragged.  Rounds to the other side.  Hoists himself up to another WINDOW.  Cautiously looks in... WALTER at the far window. Will jerks back.  Steps on the dock.  A plank CREAKS.  Sh Peers back through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER.  Still looking out.  Didn't hear a thing. Will remembers.  Walter doesn't have his hearing aid.  He deaf on that side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, looking out the window. OVER HIS SHOULDER - we see Will climbing in through the window.  Smearing blood along the sill, favoring his leg. Stands straight.  Levels his gun at Walter's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Walter continues staring out the window.  Will raises his voice. WILL (cont'd) Walter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter jumps, whips around.  Comes face to face with the  barrel of Will Dormer's gun.  Surprised.  Absently touche his deaf ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wild card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the gun, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at Will's 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That jammed the last time, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men LOCK EYES.  Wind HOWLING through the boathouse. Killer and Detective.  Only a bullet separating them. WALTER suddenly jerks up his shotgun... BANG!  He stumbles back.  Hit in the gut. Will's Smith and Wesson, smoking.  No longer jammed. Walter, touches the blood.  Looks back at Will.  Staggeri CRACK!  The rotting floor gives way beneath him.  He CRIE out, falls.  Drops into the icy water below. SILENCE.  Will steps over to the hole.  Looks down at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER, floating on his back.  Looking up at him.  Water washing over his body.  Eyes, pleading.  Fading.  A wave, gently pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another J. Brody mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will staggers out on to the dock.  Drops his gun.  Crashe his knees.  Falls back.  His face, pale.  Lying against t wood of the dock. RAIN DROPS.  Start to fall.  Washing the blood from his s Puckering the lake water.  Will's eyes...flutter... FOOTSTEPS...running along the dock.  Heavy boots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dormer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will squints against the rain.  Makes out the face of ELLIE hovering over him.  He gives a half-smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're a pain in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie kneels down next to him.  Pulls over her vest.  Cov him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks at her bloody shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, tearing off her boot.  Yanks off her sock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make a tourniquet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, fading fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Byrd killed Kay Connell.  Her things are in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Byrd's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, wraps the sock around his leg.  Starts twisting. grimaces.  Ellie swallows.  Doesn't want to ask this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot Detective Eckhart, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pained looks crosses Ellie's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you mean to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But I covered it up.  I lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN, drumming down around them.  Will, takes a deep brea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I just couldn't be wrong. (looks at her) Don't ever get that way, Ellie.  Don't  ever lose your way.  It blurs the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His blood, pumping out in rivulets.  Ellie looks down at Her hero.  Moves up to the wound in his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one looks worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will reaches up a feeble hand.  Stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Just let me sleep, Ellie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyelids, growing heavy. WILL (cont'd) Let me sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie blinks away the tears.  Knows what he means.  What wants.  Watches as the calm spreads over him. Will closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens his eyes.  She ties the second sock around his arm. ELLIE (cont'd) I will not let you sleep.  If you've lost your way then you have to make it right. That's the only way.  That's what you'd tell me.  I've been a detective for four weeks and I say you're coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up.  Slips her arms under his shoulders.  Starts hoisting him up. ELLIE (cont'd) C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.  Struggling to his knees.  Every inch of him, screa in pain.  Gets to his feet.  Arm slung around this tiny, young woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your shoulder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  I'll have a cool scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they head, slowly but surely, back down the dock.
